review: Yikes! CPK I used to LOVE you. My mom and I used to come to your place literally every other week when I was a teen. I usually don't complain about price increases but CPK's has been especially regrettable. The prices have nearly tripled since I was a teenager (but inflation hasn't, lol) and the quality of the food has gone down. (I remember half an oriental chicken salad used to be 6 bucks!) Everything here is now only so so and sometimes even poor, and it pains me to say it!!! UGH. I hate HATE how they changed the oriental chicken salad--it's so dry and tasteless now and I hate that they got rid of the Shanghai Spring Rolls. Lame!

This place is great and so was our server!! She made sure are our drinks stayed full. Rasberry Tea was great.  I love the pasta's here. But I tried the flat crust pizza pizza. And I must say it's a 4 star!!!

Can, We just talk about your there amazing salads they are so so so so good. I can't help but get one everytime i go there.. Im not a Big on pizza in fact i don't even eat pizza so im so glad thats its not just another run of the mill pizza place and everything else is secondary but at this place they really strive's to put everything on the same level and thats what i like.  This is just a great place to sit and talk and have a good time with friends plus they do have a red velet Cake need a say more.... Its all fun and games until you order a red velet cake....

I have to admit, the food here is awesome. From their spinach artichoke dip, lettuce wraps, pizzas, and the Kung pao spaghetti. I have nothing negative to say. So, do I recommend you come here for lunch or dinner?? Sure!! Keep in mind, they do not have a lunch menu so expect to pay their regular menu price.  The reason for the three stars is due to the service. It was slow. I took awhile for the food to come out and even longer time for us to get the check. I was also disappointed that we didn't get the complimentary bread and butter, Like I mentioned earlier, they do not have a lunch menu. I know you can opt to get a half size salad for lunch. Their pizzas are about $14 (a little on the pricey side). Most entrees will cost you about that much. So be prepared to have a $20 dollar lunch (entree, tax, and tip).

Miso shrimp salad is excellent. When you're watching calories its a lifesaver. Great flavor and the half portion will fill you up. I will buy a full portion and have them put it in 2 halves for just a few bucks more so I can have something later. That way I can also save room for their red velvet cake, which blows the whole watching calorie thing out of the water. I know right?

I like the food my favorite is the Thai pizza however the waitress did not offer any bread and she hardly came over to the table I had to do something to get her attention. I wouldn't have minded if the place was busy but there was hardly anyone there. Great food not so great service.

Yummy && worth the crowd && wait awesome service to, my avocado wraps were late && our waiter was concerned about always going to see if they were ready or not it got to the point where she talked to the manager && didn't charge me for them

Good service- we sat at the bar & they do a brisk to go business. Ordered a half roasted artichoke & half jamaican jerk Pizza- the jerk was cloyingly sweet with a little spice - not what I was expecting- its like they mixed their sweet BBQ sauce in with some spice. all in all a good experience.

I love CPK. The food is always great and the service is usually just as good. Pizza is my favorite and this place always hits the spot. Salads are good, soups are good and the pizza is phenomenal. The waiters/waitresses are always friendly and nice. The atmosphere is usually relaxed and comfortable. If you love pizza/meat as much as I do then try the "Meat Lovers" pizza. If you're looking for something to quench your thirst that isn't soda, try the Mango Iced tea! They also have amazing desserts. Last time I was here I tried the buttercream cake and it was AMAZING. This place is just awesome.

Healthy Pizzas....yes you heard me right.  Pizzas which are healthy - made on whole wheat crust, easy on cheese and sauce, loads of veggies. Their salads rock and the varieties of pizzas you can get is great. Great to have food with family and friends. Next to south bay Galleria, so makes shopping also easy. desserts are also good. Love this place

California Pizza Kitchen just isn't what it once was AND I got food poisoning the last time I was there (7/6/12). I ordered the Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza and it was the only thing I had eaten that day before I started feeling sick...then it all went downhill :( I kept having to hunt down the waitress for everything I needed; refill, water, napkin. She was not very attentive and the restaurant was not packed. She was friendly...so, that's a plus.  They have expanded their menu but they took out a few of my favorite dishes including my ultimate favorite...the Carne Asada pizza. They replaced it with carnitas but I'm allergic to pork so that doesn't work for me. There are a lot of salad, pizza, and pasta choices. The Arugula salad is delish! I like the small bites option, the chicken quesadilla is pretty tasty. I've had more positive experiences but the fact that I got really sick from the food does not entice me to return any time soon. I miss the old menu and service.

Went with Kevin W. to go get a bite to eat.  We didn't have much time but we felt like some pizza, here's how we did..... Right as we walked in we were pleasantly greeted by 2 hostesses.  They sat us in Kristy's section.  Kristy did a fantastic job promoting the new Artisian pizza.  I ordered the Habanero Carnitas (pic) pizza.  Kevin ordered the salmon (pic) something or other.  I wasn't sure what to drink so Kristy suggested the mango lemonade.  What a dream!  I love mango and to mix it with a lemonade, mmmmmm!  When we got our food it was served with ranch.  I asked her if this is standard and she said "No, but you look like a ranch type of guy so I just brought it."  Maybe it's because I'm fat but either way it saved me the trouble of having to ask for it.  Thanks again Kristy!   I guess the pizzas are new and I was given a $5.00 credit for filling out a pizza survey.  This was great, and it gave me an excuse not to talk to my lunch date Kevin W.  All in all our experience at CPK this day was perfect! Will I again?..  I will for sure but only if Kristy is working!  Mmmmmmm!

I've always liked CPK...generally. Last time I went here, our waiter randomly gave us 4 tickets to the Angel's game..o.o For no reason at all... I always usually order their fettuccine alfredo. I've noticed that they don't give you bread anymore, unless you ask. & since when do they ask what kind of water you'd like?
slow service even though few people were dining. ordered a salad (good) and a pizza (bad). Pizza was overcooked.

I used to love this place, but lately I've noticed the quality of the service here going downhill. I would usually brush it off and just tell myself that their employees might just be having a bad day, but when I dined in at CPK yesterday, I could not believe what an employee said. The hostess offered us alcoholic drinks, we said we'd pass on that offer because we were all driving, she then mentioned that drinking alcohol before driving would make the drive home more fun. Um, how about no? California Pizza Kitchen, please train your pre-teen staff to not encourage customers to break the law -- thanks.  From now on, I will most likely drive an extra fifteen minutes and dine at the other California Pizza Kitchen in Manhattan Beach.

I was not impressed with the food during my latest trip to CPK. I'm typically delighted to visit CPK and get a slice of their famous BBQ chicken pizza. However, after today, I might not come back. I also experienced similar food quality at the CPK in Manhattan Beach so this appears to be a pattern.     The waitress was friendly; hardly anything special. We sat next to particularly loud Australian tourists (but that's another story). I sat across from my brother who ordered the same thing I did; BBQ chicken pizza. I was so hungry and couldn't wait for the bread to come. Unfortunately, the bread was a small piece of warm sourdough cut into four pieces with a little oil for dipping on the side. I've been eating at CPK since I was old enough for a kids menu so I typically remember their bread being more abundant and having a little butter. Previously, the bread was always very thick and was constantly brought to the table by the waitress before we could finish it all. It was their signature. Alas, all good things must come to an end so I was going to forgive them of their sub par dinner bread that we got just one plate of...until the pizza came.      I also remember having cloth napkins instead of paper but never mind; what's a few thousand trees for your dining pleasure? Anywho, the pizza came. It was a burnt, disgusting mess. I ate because I was hungry but I didn't enjoy it. The taste was all wrong. I almost wished I just bought their store-bought frozen option instead. My brother didn't seem to notice a difference but he typically inhales food. The onion just didn't seem fresh and juicy. THe BBQ chicken was splattered on there. I was just unimpressed period.     CPK, I'm begging you. I really want to make this work. I'm trying to make amends here. You know, for the kids. But in sum, my experience sucked and I wanted the world to know. CPK please get your management, chefs, and oven temperature together. You have so much potential.

My cousin and I love this place.  We come here frequently after work for drinks and their amazing salads!  The manager Ryan, is absolutely fabulous and always takes care of us while we are there.  I would definitely to anyone looking for good service and good food.

I don't know why I got the Chicken Tequila Pasta. That was a weird choice of mine that cold November. Waiter why did you recommend that to me!!!??! I should have gotten a regular item like PIZZA or normal pasta like alfredo? My auntie and uncle got a delicious salad and pasta, which I kept getting bites from. At the end of the meal, we got a butter cake because of all the people nearby getting the same dessert... you know what I mean. Staring at food when it passes by. We all do it! Looks are deceiving when it comes to this butter cake. It looks innocent and simple... but when you take your first bite... it hits you! This is probably the best dessert I have ever had in a chain restaurant... and that's saying A LOT. I don't know how to describe it, but just know it was rich, buttery, warm... and topped with vanilla ice cream... mmmm. 4 stars baby, four stars for you CPK Redondo Beach.
The customer service is awesome.   The greeter comes out the door when he see you walk up and welcomes you to the restaurant. We were seated right away.  Server was nice. Food was good.

I remember coming to CPK when I first moved to SC and thought it was great back then.  I cant believe these reviews.  I sorta rediscovered this place recently and loved the menu upgrade with what looks like new offerings.  I tried the quinoa salad which was great.  The prices did seem to go up but the food is still very good. Service was pretty good both times I recently came here.

This review is for the facility and service at this particular location.  In general CPK is great, but I'm disappointed this location has gone downhill.  When this was the only CPK around (10+ years ago), I would drive a half hour to eat here and it was my favorite restaurant.  Now, I'd rather go to the one in South Torrance. I'll start with the staff.  Went to the bar just for drinks and the bartender was so aloof it was like he didn't care at all about service.  Mixed up the two kinds of red wine a friend and I ordered, brought us the wrong size pours, kept asking if we were ready to order even though we said when we sat down that we were only having drinks, and never brought the water I asked for.   The bathrooms are DISGUSTING! I realize this is at a shopping mall so there's a lot of traffic, but that doesn't mean that a nice sit-down restaurant where people are spending upwards of $30 per person by the time they get out the door should have a bathroom more suited to a gas station.  Actually, I've been in MANY gas station bathrooms that are more pleasant than this one.  On a busy weekend night, they need to stay on top of the cleanliness much better. Both of these factors are a huge turnoff to ever return to a place that clearly doesn't value customer experience.  I guess when you're in such a busy location and customers keep streaming through no matter how crappy the service is and how dirty the restaurant, why would you try any harder? It's a shame because I think as a whole CPK has a lot to offer and a great menu, but stay away from this one.

I love the Thai pizza and had one last night that had no toppings. The server told me that the new owners had changed the way it's made. Too bad. But, the manager did not charge for the pizza and the server Mikey was great. Not a five star rating but 4 for service. Maybe stay away from the pizzas.

Hadn't been to CPK in about five years because I thought it was going down hill...food quality had gone down. Well, I had a CPK gift card to use up and decided to give it another try. So glad I did!! The menu is now much better as is the food quality.  I had a thin crust pizza. It was the thinnest crust I've ever had on a pizza. I don't know how they do it, but it's cracker thin, maybe even thinner than that!  I'm not a carb fan, but love the taste of pizza, so it was perfect!! I also split the Spring Market Vegetable Salad. It was unbelievably good and choc ful of healthy ingredients. Lots of colors. Fun to look at and very enjoyable to eat!! Way to go CPK. I'm really impressed with all the improvements!!

I love their avocado club eggrolls and their Waldorf salad!  This location is definitely not my favorite, but I still come here because it's close to home. Service is usually okay, but every now and then I'll get an awkward server.

Nothing spectacular, either food or service.  Waiter was efficient, but not overly friendly, and didn't offer any suggestions, other than his required offerings of appetizers and desserts.  We order the Meat Lovers and Unusual Cheese pizzas.  Both just run-of-the-mill.  Probably won't go out of our way to return until the next gift card or coupon comes along.  Maybe I'll try a salad and pasta then.

This place is just okay.  It's nothing special, but it makes for an easy group outing.   Pluses: Easy Parking Clean Healthy Options Nice server Neutral: Our server was very sweet, but she must not be used to L.A. girls eating, because she tried to remove my food while I was only half way done.  She actually started taking the plate out from under me while I had food in my mouth.  She told me that I would have a ton of leftovers and that the pizza would reheat well.  I ate every bite of my pizza and polished off my friend's salad and was still hungry.  I guess I am a hungry hippo.   Negatives: The food is mediocre.  I ordered the California Veggie on Wheat.  It's kind of blah.  Everything I have eaten here is just kind of blah.  My friend's Peach salad was somewhat tastier, but nothing that special. The place was almost deserted on a Monday night.
Great food....but it's bad when you have to ask the manager to bring you refills.   Great meal spoiled by a terrible waitress.

I've been here lots of times with my parents when we're in the mood for pizza. I went last week with my sister in law and our service was horrible.. the waiter came to our table and took our drink orders and food orders because we already knew what we wanted. After like 2 minutes the waiter brought the wine my sis ordered but he didnt bring my drink! He didn't even seem to remember me ever ordering it (see what happens when you don't write things down?).. I had to ask someone else, who looked like a manager, to bring me my drink because it was never brought to our table. Our food came pretty quickly, which is great! What wasn't great was that the waiter didnt even come check up on us (like every good waiter should do), the only time he came to check up on us was when the booth behind us received their food.  i was hoping he wouldnt tell us something like "i was busy with other tables" because it was a tuesday, it wasn't busy at all. I work in a restaurant as well and i understand most reasons of bad service but...come on now...really? this was just awful. ..too bad the waiter never even told us his name because if he did i'd ask the host not to sit us in his section.

I've been to this CPK location many times before, but my last visit was exceptional thanks to Suzanne. I typically don't write the staffs name in my reviews, but she really was excellent. I came with my parents to enjoy a nice dinner. Suzanne was our waitress and she was great! Very personable, upbeat and knowledgeable. She made our dining experience a great one. Thank you Suzanne! Food:  Chopped BBQ chicken salad: This is always a must when I come here. The salad coems with chicken, tomatoes, beans, corn, cheese and is tossed in ranch and topped off with a drizzle of BBQ sauce. One of the better salads that I've had.  Garlic chicken pizza: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! This pizza had garlic, chicken, carmelized onions, fresh mozzarella, parmesan, slivered scallions and cracked black pepper. The combination of flavors was amazing! Honestly, you don't even need the chicken on this pizza. The flavors from the garlic, cheese and onions makes this a winner in my books!  Habanero carnitas pizza: A pizza with carnitas pork, red onions and cilantro. The habanero salsa is served on the side. The combination is great. I remember the first time I got the pizza, the habanero salsa was ridiculously hot, but I'm assuming they got some complaints since this past time it wasn't that hot at all. It's a great pizza with great flavor! Jambalaya fettucine: The jambalaya here isn't my favorite. Maybe it's because I prefer my jambalaya with rice? They do however give you plenty of shrimp and Louisiana sausage.  Overall, it was a great dinner. The garlic chicken pizza and the service were exceptional!

I decided to have dinner alone and they immediately wanted me to sit at the bar. I told them I didn't want too. They stated the tables were for 2 or more. I said I wanted a table and was seated. Once I ordered I watched as other customers entered and were ignored because the nearly entire staff were behind the bar talking and laughing. I watched them laughing while a few employee were working. I literally had to ask for someone to bring my drink that sat at the counter for 7 minutes and she was not happy. My order was delivered not as ordered. Perhaps the staff could use a little retraining on customer service and realize they are not at work to socialize, but to work and take care of their customers.
Came by last Friday after work, no wait at all. Ordered mushroom pizza and the italian chopped salad. Our server was great. They had no problem redeeming my mobile discount offer. No complaints!

The wife and decided to have dinner after work while traffic lightens up a bit. Upon nearing the door they open it up for you and greet you as you walk in. We didn't have to wait to be seated since we showed up before the dinner rush.  As our waiter who was super cool asked us what we wanted to drink. My wife got a wine and I asked him what kind of beers they had on tap. He mentioned a couple local beers that I haven't heard of and he even asked if I wanted to taste them before making a choice. I could not decline that offer. When he brought me the samples they were umm...more than a sample in my eyes. I'm totally good with that! I still ordered a beer but my wife gladly took a sample away from me. lol  My wife being the coupon freak that she is, found a deal online through her phone and asked our waiter if they accepted it. He took it to his manager and with no hesitation they accepted it deducted that amount from our bill. Pretty dope! Pretty much the food was great and the service was excellent.

Standard CPK fare generally, and service is good. The interesting part is that this is their "test kitchen", so they try new dishes on the menu there (not identified though, so you have to ask or know their menu to figure out which are the special ones). A good pizza break from mall shopping.....remember to ask for the free bread instead of ordering an appetizer.

I only came here because there wasn't any place I wanted to eat at this mall.  Good service.  Not a fan of the fish tacos.  I didn't enjoy the California club sandwich on ciabatta bread.  I enjoyed the fennel sausage flatbread pizza.  Soup was ok.  Not very big portions.  Well lit but cold.

Great place for lunch or dinner.  They now have a lunch special Monday-Friday.  The specials are a large portion.  The pizzas are delicious and very fresh.  You can even get the gluten free crust!  The pastas are pretty large size portions.  I also love there martini's!

I ordered the grilled vegetable salad with shrimp, and the pizza works. The food was delicious. I would have given it a five star but unfortunately it seems as if they decrease the amount of vegetables in the salad. it seems as if they got a little skimpy with avocados and vegetables.. The service was just ok..well that's being nice... the service was fair..food was delicious. .i guess it's hard to find good service, and good food..

Umm... Is it just me or does it seem like the CPK headquarters took over all of their locations' Yelp pages? They don't seem controlled by the users, as opposed to other restaurants. I smell something fishy here. Anyhow. Other than their sketchy Yelp pages, I am a fan of CPK. I find myself craving it ALL the time, and I've already been here a countless number of times since high school.  Located basically within the mall, this is a great restaurant to go to after a long day of shopping. The food is solid, the service is solid, and they give free bread. Any restaurant that gives out free bread is a friend of mine. The parking around CPK is rarely pleasant. Most parking spots are going to be found far from the restaurant, but the walk isn't too bad. You need to be careful though, because my cousin's car was broken into once here. FOOD * BBQ Chicken Pizza (5/5) My favorite pizza here. It doesn't hurt that I love barbecue sauce, but bbq sauce + pizza?! Um, this will be a 5/5 for me! The chicken is moist and flavorful, and the crust is perfect. Usually I don't eat pizza crusts, but I always eat their pizza crusts with this pizza. * Waldorf Chicken Salad (5/5) Ahhhhh. I love this salad sooo much. It includes everything you could possibly need in a waldorf salad, but in the highest degree possible. Grapes, walnuts, candied walnuts, gorgonzola cheese, all mixed together in a perfect dressing. Yum yum yum yum yum x129892385. * Spinach Artichoke Dip (4/5) Soooo good! Nobody can go wrong with spinach artichoke dip. This comes with chips, and the dip just melts in your mouth. Highly recommended for big parties only, though. Because this appetizer can be quite filling. * California Club (4/5) Greens, avocado, bacon and tomatoes. Yumms! Someone in my party always ends up getting this. I love everything about this pizza except maybe the mayo dressing. It's just too heavy for me.  * Thai Chicken (3/5) This was pretty tasty. This is an unexpected pizza flavor, but it was not unexpected for me to like it because I love Thai food and I love pizza. However, I will not be getting this pizza again because it was just too salty for me. I love CPK. And I will always be coming back, as long as they don't raise their prices anymore.

My friends and I ordered the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza and the Chicken Lettuce Wrap.  We also got the Strawberry Pina Colada.  Everything was good that we ordered another round!  Aside from the food, the customer service needs work.  The waiter forgot to bring our friend his soda and when our drink was brought over, they forgot the straws.  Also, when the second order of chicken lettuce wraps was brought over, they took away all the spoons so we had nothing to scoop up the sauce with.  Did we need extra plates? We weren't asked.  We ate off our napkins and later found some plates on the side next to our booth.  I think the staff/waiters were new???  Probably, one of them kept apologizing.  The hosts were good though, they opened the doors without asking!  Other than that, I liked this location.  It was my first time here...
BBQ chicken pizza with bacon was fire. Server john did good , hit all the points of good service. Def comin again

The food has always been great!  Before, they brought bread with butter, but now it comes with olive oil instead!  Quite a pleasant surprise! With that aside, the more important part of the experience: service!  As far as promptness and presentation, they did a great job!  One thing: from my previous experiences with other CPK locations, I always go with a friend and we split a full size salad.  They've always brought us a pair of spoons so that we can stir up the salad so that all of the condiments are well dispersed.  I've noticed that this particular location doesn't provide us spoons until we ask for them.  It would be convenient so we don't have to use each other's forks to initially stir it up!

California Pizza Kitchen is always an excellent choice. This may seem weird but I elected to go with the soup and sandwich option. The loaded baked potato soup was absolutely amazing. The only thing that stopped this from being a 5 star review is the sandwich. I really wanted to tty the cuban but apparently they only make that for lunch. I had to get the California club which tasted really good, but it wasn't the Cuban.

Been coming here for years.  Food is always just ok.  They use to have a peanut coleslaw that I loved ... and it's no longer offered.  They also use to have an Italian sandwich on focaccia bread ... and it's no longer offered.  The Peach Salad is my go to item. Gave this location four stars because I always have great attentive service.

Forget something?  Recently, a few friends and I went to dinner at CPK. The first thing you should know is we had no budget. An extraordinary set of circumstance existed that allowed us to order anything we wanted. We had no limits!  So needless to say, the drinks were flowing. Wine, whiskey, and beer populated our table like a Chinese subway station. We ordered a variety of appetizers to include Spinach Dip, Avocado Eggrolls, and more. Sadly, our server forgot to put our order in and we didn't see those appetizers until most of our entrees were digested. He was very apologetic and we could tell it was a one-time thing. Plus, we had him so busy with drink orders that it was completely understandable. Don't worry about it Juan, you're still our boy!  Our entrees included an assortment of CPK's best to include the halibut, the ribeye, a couple salads, and some pizzas. I ordered the Meat Cravers Pizza myself. The thin crusted pizza had more meat than the Spearmint Rhino on a Friday night. What stood out was the Capicola Ham. The salty ham coupled with the spicy Italian Sausage really gelled well together. This is by far my favorite pizza at CPK. I did however have a bite of the Ribeye. Even though this was a pizza based restaurant, they offer a mean steak.  Not only was the presentation worthy of a steak house, the meat was seasoned with fresh garlic that's help solidify a nicely executed meal.  Al though CPK is more of a "cookie cutter" restaurant, it's a solid choice for any occasion. We really challenged them during this meal with constant drink orders, appetizers, entrée quality and presentation, and punctuality. Not to mention, our service was enthusiastic and friendly. Juan made a mistake missing the appetizers but when he caught it, he was on it like a flies on sh*t. I enjoyed myself. I will keep CPK as a go-to spot.
The Cesar calls is so good and do is the margarita pizza. Those are my go to when I come here.

Good pizza although  there was a pizza that came with a salad that was blah looking but kinda good, the salad came on top of the pizza. At first I thought I had ordered a salad lol it's a good incentive but by the time u get  done with the salad the pizza is already cold.

The service at this location is always very friendly and expedient. It can get crowded, but I've never had to wait for a table, and the servers are always really nice. 4 stars for the service. This time around we ordered the spinach artichoke pizza and the thai crunch salad. Relatively speaking, the food here is really good compared to Olive garden or another chain italian restaurant.  I also ordered a mai-tai, and it had a kick! Was definitely worth the $14 or whatever it cost.

Very often I have poor experiences here at cpk. Let's start with today, dining with a friend around 1pm, where our waitress Jazmin failed to remain attentive throughout our meal, she didn't check on us once to ask how we were doing. Lacked any person skills. She didn't even bring out the food, Jessie whom looked like the manager, brought our food to us and served us more water multiple times because our waitress was nowhere to be found. I ordered chicken in my Cesar salad and it came without and without even realizing, I paid $3.99 extra for it.  Not the greatest experience but also not the first one either.

worst CPK experience ever. ordered curbside and was told to come between 8 and 8:10 pm showed up at 8:05 and called to say we were there. waited 15 minutes for server to come out with the food.  I dont know what happened to the food at CPK, I have been eating and enjoying for years, not tonight. To start my sons kids apple juie was handed through the car window dripping all over me, it was in a kids cup that had a lid that didnt fit at all we had to pour in a cup when we got home. Everything was cold, the tortilla soup that I have had a million times and LOVED was sour and uneatable my sons pepperoni pizza was not only not hot but literally cold like it was supposed to go to someone else an hour before. I ordered the chopped salad which usually you have to request if you want garbanzo beans (i am not a fan so I dont) well they decided to put them in and it wasnt just a few garbanzos half the salad was composed of them.  My husband had the california club which of course was luke warm and dry! no flavor.  The only saving grace was the butter cake dessert. Not sure if it was just this CPK or if they have all declined but I know for a fact I will never go back to this one, $50 for 2 adults and a 2 year old and for HORRIBLE food is not acceptable. we should have done cheesecake factory to-go like the original plan was

Came here for my friend Debbie W's birthday lunch with a group of work friends.   Our waiter was absolutely terrible.  His attitude gave off like he just didn't want to be there and he was doing us a favor.  He had this sour look to his face the entire time.  He totally brought out the wrong pizza oder for one of our friends.  We all heard what our friend ordered was a pepperoni and mushroom pizza.  But he brought out the same pizza, a spinach and cheese pizza as someone else at the table had ordered.  And the snarky waiter doesn't apologize for his apparent mistake and oversight, but says that is what our friend ordered.  WTF?!   On top of that, it took him forever to bring our bill.  We had to ask 3 times before we got our bill. The food was good, but there service was sub par.  This waiter is in the wrong job.  He needs to be put back in the kitchen or be a bus boy, where he has no customer contact.

Super crowded when we arrived. The waitress was nice but she dint give us enough time to look at the menu, she kept asking if were ready multiple times which i dint like,so had to quickly order something to have her stop doing that, we got the ChipotleChicken pizza which was exactly like eating a bowl of chipotle but on a pizza bread. It was fresh with cucumber and cilantro and beans , i am impressed and might definitely come back for this one Also got the pesto creme penne, which was ok, it dint have much pesto as the name says, and also the penne was hard and i could immediately sense its not boiled fresh. Also the pasta dish was not warm at all.

Never again.  I used to like this place but the service and the food are going nothing but downhill.   Today, server gave my toddler a cup with apple juice with the wrong size top.  Spills all over her pants.  I ask the Manager over and tell him that they should not be passing out these cups (they used to have better cups and they have gone cheap), he brings the correct top, claims they just came in today.  Doesn't apologize or bring napkins.  Just plain dumb, you're a Manager.  So I was a little pissed about that.  Then, there is no one in there and I ordered soup/salad combo and a kids meal.  It was working on 15 minutes and nothing came out.  I got up and told the server to cancel it, he was like, it's coming out now, really that's great but I am leaving!  I was  angry and didn't feel like spending my money in an establishment run by dumb people.  Pass
Love it! Every time I come here I get service really fast. The food is great! Must try the Original bbq chicken pizza and the garlic cream fettuccini.
Located at the Southbay Galleria.  I always get great service and food here.  On this visit, I tried the ribeye steak, it did not dissapoint!

CPK is the place to go! (If you have the right server)  I went to cpk on Saturday i was welcomed by the two host opening the door i believe their names were Bry Terri and Shay. i sat down, it took a while for my server to get there and greet me, after he greeted me i was looking for him to bring me some bread and butter but he was no where to be found. Luckily Bry passed by and was asking tables how they were doing and if they were doing ok, he approached my table and i asked if he could tell my server to get some bread and without a doubt he answered "Dont worry im on it!" he came back in a flash and later came our food. Our Pizzas were to die for! Cant go wrong with Jamaican Jerk! Bry constantly appeared by tables and seemed more intrigued with the tables than the servers were. To end the night the host rushed to the door and got the door for us!  Great food Great people (most of the time) Recommend the Jamaican jerk!

After a long hiatus of not coming to this location my bf wanted to try it so we cruised in and we were seated right away.  We weren't overly hungry so we started with the hummus and split the Jamaican jerk pizza.  The bread that they offer now is delicious.  It's that thick sourdough and they bring it with oil to dip it in.  So glad that they moved away from that other bread (if you could even call it that) that they were serving. However, it was bread overload for us.  Between the pita for the hummus, the sourdough bread and the pizza itself, it was a lot.  The hummus was really good and the pizza was just OK.  It was a little sweet for my taste but it was good regardless.  I will be back again but I would skip the hummus unless I was getting a salad or pasta.

What can I say, we waited for 40 min for our food because of our original waiter. KIARA came to deliver us the bad news that our order was never put in. The service went from a one star to a five star after that. She kept updating us, offered us soup and kept our bellies full. Plus we got  50% off our bill, can't complain. We WILL be back. Thank you Kiara. (sorry if I spelled ur name wrong)

Came here with my folks one friday night. The waiter was terrible.. Our drinks came in after about 15 mins. wait. Our meal came in 30 mins after. The steak came in cold and our soup wasn't served. We needed condiments and refills and had to ask other waiters.He never came to ask how we're doing. We've been dining here couple of times and service has always been good except today!!! I will probably come back again with hopes of not getting that same waiter!!! No bueno..

Ahh, CPK, I've been coming here for years now and it is one of my go to pizza / pasta  restaurants! I usually get the cheese pizza but I've been falling in love with the pesto cream penne pasta! It's delicious. I love coming here because the staff is always friendly and you are greeted with their complementary bread and olive oil.  If you have not checked out this place I highly recommend it highly. I'm never disappointed when I come here! The dessert is heavenly too!

They've made changes for the better. The menu has new items and great healthy choices. They also bring much better bread while you wait which is 10x better than what they previously served. The shrimp scampi and cedar salmon were delicious.
The food is awesome!!!  It's CPK!!! Need I say more??!?

My husband and I ate here after not eating here for a very long time and it was very good, surprisingly so! We liked the carmelized peach salad and the thincrust pizza seemed less chewy than last time, more crunchy crust the way we like it. I'll be more likely to come here after this good experience.

I typically don't bother to review chains, but my experience with CPK today left a lot to be desired.   The Good: I really like the outdoor seating area, and they add warmers at night so that you don't get too chilly.  Our server was also very friendly.  So, those things warrant two stars. The Not-So-Good: There was a ridiculous wait to order despite the restaurant being half empty.  Then it took forever to get our drinks, which I thought was ridiculous considering how little time it takes to make a drink.  I would think that restaurants would operate the way casinos do--get them drunk so they will spend.   The food could have been good, but we each ordered dishes with shrimp in them and the shrimp were terribly overcooked.  Shrimp is one of those foods that just tastes terrible if it has been sitting on a hot plate too long. Overall a totally meh experience and I am in no hurry to return.

I really don't know what to say about this place, the service used to be on point. Until today. I'm currently sitting here while many people are getting served and getting their food when they were here after me! There is a party of 6 that got their food while my party of three is still waiting.  Updated based on the whole experience:  My food finally came an hour after waiting patiently. The only bad part is, everyones food was correct except for mine. I even pointed at what I wanted to the server, and she got my order wrong. After telling her that I didn't order this, I also told her that I didn't want it so she can take it off my bill. She apologized, but she kept asking me if I was sure..we were going back and forth for almost three minutes. My boyfriend knew I was getting more annoyed after I told her I was sure for the third time. Throughout my time there, she did ask if we wanted refills, however we never got our drinks back until I finally paid the bill. I don't think I'll ever come back here.

Horrible Experience! I had an absolutely horrible experience at the Redondo Beach CPK last night and was beyond disappointed with the service and food. I had not visited CPK in a very long time and was looking forward to one of your classic pizzas I used to love. After I placed my order it took their SLOW staff 30 minuets plus to bring what I had ordered. When they brought my pizza they clearly made a mistake and tried to cover up the fact that they FORGOT the sauce and proceeded to add a heaping amount of raw vegetables and splashed of sauce on the already cooked pizza. Absolutely absurd! I was starving and wouldn't touch the disgusting food.

Took forever for anybody to come get our drink order. The hostess ended up coming over and doing it. Took another 30-45m to get our drinks and break. Waitress does not even check up on us even though she walks right by. I saw other customers get up and go find her. Asked the manager for some bread but never got it until after our food arrived and we had to ask again. Like I said worst CPK experience and we have eaten here before. I think they need to hire more staff or do some basic training.

We have been to many locations and by far this is our favorite location. The manager Jessica is amazing! Always has a smile and super friendly! We love our servers Jessie and Bree!!!! We love coming here!  Thank you so much for your amazing service and yummy food!

I think we may have had a new server on the day we visited. It took us a while to get service. 3 of us asked for water with lemon. Never got the lemon. It also took a while to get our food. We never got our utensils (even after asking for them). I had to get up and find the basket and got them for the table. The food was good. I was actually impressed by the hummus. But the service did leave a little something to be desired.

This location overall is a hit or a miss.  There is plenty of parking as it's located outside the mall.  The food is okay and can be below CPK standards.  I've had to return food either because it's over cooked, under cooked or had hair in it.  The service is average not because the people suck but over worked.  If you are lucky enough to get a stellar server on a not so busy day consider yourself lucky. If it's a busy day or night, expect your experience to be kinda bad. One of managers, Jessica, is super sweet and genuinely cares.   I would suggest going to the location in Rolling Hills Plaza. Their service is much better and the food is above average and you will not find hair in your food.

1st time I'm here, service was great our waiter Doug was awesome, but the food disappointed me, it had hair wrapped around the shrimp it COMPLETELY Killed my appetite. If i had to grade this place on food quality it would be ZERO but the service and time was good. Bitter sweet feeling

What can I say, I don't know why I expected better since it's a chain and full of little kids... but we went here for a change of pace and a quick bite.  The service was terrible (waitress attempted to take our drink order while hands full of another table's dirty dishes she had just picked up, numerous people forgot to bring us silverware and napkins, took forever to get the check, etc...) Food was forgettable, I'll tell you that the bbq chicken salad I remember from years back is not what it used to be... boyfriend's thai salad had been sitting for a while and had super wilted lettuce.  Place is chock full of screaming kids and parents who do not nothing about them.  Needless to say, will NOT return.

Great food, fast service, friendly staff, clean bathrooms. I couldn't ask for more if I wanted to. The Valentine's Day special is awesome btw and the drinks are delicious. Not too watery either ;).  Lots of space so it's a great place for groups of 4-8 and maybe more with help from the staff. I honestly don't have any complaints and I can't wait to visit again.
Really good service....little to no wait....Sunny and Jessica were awesome! We'll def be back

I came here with my "little brother" from church.  We came here on a Sunday afternoon around 5:00 after seeing a movie upstairs.  The restaurant is always super busy and crowded. I had the Thai Peanut Salad (vegetarian without the meat option).  The salad was made with cabbage, won bok, fried rice noodles, and other veggies.  The sauce was a Thai inspired peanut sauce.  The salad was sprinkled with sesame seeds.  The salad was very basic, mellow, and well made.  I enjoyed it. My "little brother" had the BBQ Chicken Pizza, which was about a 12" pizza topped with a generous portion of chicken and BBQ sauce.  He really enjoyed it. My table mate ordered the Thai Noodles with Shrimp.  HOLY SMOKES!  This was the winner dish of the table.  There was spaghetti noodles with red chili peppers, shrimp, and veggies.  The base sauce is a peanut sauce.  The dish was spicy, savory, and delightful!   I just wished it was my dish instead!  hah! Super kudos and thanks go to Leon, the restaurant manager, who always makes a great outreach effort to support the community.  CPK often supports our Church efforts and provides food for community events.  Thank you! Food Grade:  B+ Service Grade:  A- Worth the Money Grade:  A- Overall Impression Grade:  B+/A-
I went with my baby brother for the first time ... The service was OK .... The waiter took a while ... But the food was amazing ... The pina colada was DELICIOUS!

Yummy! Just as I had remembered this place. My sister and I had a nice lunch here yesterday and it was really pleased. Our server was sara? I believe that was her name. She was really nice and attentive to our needs. When asked if you'd like some bread just say yes! It's so tasty. The oil has some rosemary in it and it compliments the bread very well.  I tried their Caribbean sangria and it was so refreshing! The glass they put it in is huge so there's a lot of sangria in there ;) Lol would definitely get it again!  The pizza was delicious! I got the works and my sister tried the jerk chicken. Yummies! We requested some ranch to dip our pizza in and it was perfect! Only downfall is they charge .50 cents per side of ranch. So don't over indulge as we did haha.  OMG and do desert. Always do desert. Especially here! We tried the butter cake with some hagen daaz ice cream on top *droools*. The cake was warm and perfectly buttery and the ice cream complimented it so well!! Must try.  I love CPK! Be careful though with your pickings, the bill adds up pretty quick! I don't remember cpk being that pricey, but hey you get what you pay for :P

Food was okay but service is lacking.  At one point all the servers disappeared into the back and you could hear them laughing and carrying on.  Our food stood on the counter aiting.   Food took longer than usual to prep also. Need to tighten up service.

Cpk curbside pick up service  is very unprofessional. I ordered food at 710 they said my food would be ready at 730 I get there I called letting them know I was outside and I got put on hold for 10 mins no one came on the phone or went outside, I called back I got no answer I called back again phone kept ringing it sounded like someone from the kitchen answered I heard dishes in the background and I told the guy who answered who I was and that I was waiting outside for my food. He said he would let someone know so I kept waiting outside for another 15 mins no one came out Noone called me so I left by that time it was 8 pm there iam pregnant and hungry and annoyed and upset.

I had not been to a CPK for nearly 10 years and went with friends recently. There are many changes to the menu and service and I have to say they are all good. Of course each location has a manager and I hear that the one who runs this location is quite a star in the company. The staff was super friendly and I tasted all four dishes that we ordered and they were delicious! From pizza to pasta I think this is one of the best bets in the area!

The manager is awesome! She walks by every once in a while to make sure everything is going well and will even bring you bread and refills. I know that doesn't seem like a big deal, but I don't remember the last time a manager of a restaurant did this or provided my friends and I with such great service. If you are in the South Bay and want to get a good meal and good service, make sure you check this CPK!

I've visited this place a number of times. I'm sitting here now & thought to write a review. Ryan is an amazing manager. It's a busy Sunday and his staff has messed up so now he is serving his displeased customers himself after extending apologies. Wonderful customer service. He knows how to turn unhappy people to pleased customers that will return.

Still the worst pizza in the South Bay  Told myself never never come back here again and was out with my girlfriend and she was craving a salad  so I made the mistake and said sure  big mistake had a soggy limp crapy pizza same as the last try at this dump never again. HALF STAR  at best

My wife and I frequent CPK . Like other locations the food is always good , however the service is hit and miss. The service is not necessarily better at this location versus the one in Manhattan beach or the one in Rollinghills 5 Crenshaw Blvd.
Somehow always I feel this place is just ok. The Jamaican Pizza I ordered was a thin crust with little chicken and not upto mark. The ambiance is good and the service is app-laudable.

My wife and I love this place and we are most at home while seated at the bar. Not only do you get more personal attention, but the ability to watch you food being made including the tossing of the pizza dough is an added bonus. David is the best and he treats you like one of the family. Jessica always welcomes us and is very nice. We have come to know everybody by name, even our favorite pizza chefs, Luis and Jose. As for the food, we have never been disappointed.  We usually start with the focaccia bread, which is not on the menu any longer. The seasonal salad strawberry fields is to die for.  Add to it, the California Club pizza and the asparagus and spinach spagatini and the only problem is you don't have room for any of their delicious desert. The other pizzas we have tried have all been equally as good. At night, when the doors are being held open, it can be cool and breezy, so make sure you have enough warm clothes on. We have dined at three different locations in the South Bay and this one is by far our favorite.

I love their food and drinks however this particular location has some rude staff. my friend and our toddlers went out to eat here and we asked specifically if we could have a booth because of our active children (their floors are hardwood, the chairs are kinda high, the Booster seats have no restraints)  the hostess went on to say she couldn't make accommodations for us and basically we couldn't move. my daughter was coloring while sitting in the Booster on the chair and fell. everyone scrambled to help us after the fact and the original hostess made no eye contact, no apology or anything. however her managers were very nice and apologetic and proceeded to give us our food and drinks free because of the inconvenience. I probably won't be returning to this location. love lovd live cpk thoo

I come here at least a few times per month and have been pleased with the level of service and professionalism that their staff members have presented each and every time! They have inside and outside seating as well. It's also conveniently located just outside of the South Bay Galleria mall - there's valet parking available and plenty of self-parking spots available throughout the structure. Nothing better than going on a shopping spree then topping it all off with some dinner at California Pizza Kitchen!

5 stars for the hardwork of our server Jesus 1 star for the service (not his fault) 1 star for management. Listen, its graduation season, how the heck can you be shortstaffed anticipating that people are going to come in? for the whole restaurant they had like 4 servers 3 cooks, etc.  We never got our bread, never got refills on drinks etc, because our server was swampped with customers and they were running them rampant. He ended up giving crappy service but it wasnt his fault its manager's fault. Please be prepared with staffing next time.

I've been a CPK fan for a long time. This includes the Manhattan Beach location and the countless frozen pizza I've purchased as a substitute. This particular location at the Galleria has never disappointed and it didn't this time. On Thursday, I went to this location to celebrate my niece's 8th grade graduation. It has been quite a few years, because the whole menu has changed! I came up when Italian soda with peach syrup was the go-to drink! (Do they still make those anymore?) -Food- I was bored of the BBQ Chicken Pizza and tried to the Spicy Chipotle and it didn't disappoint! It was the perfect blend of flavor, sweet, sour, and meat. The vegetables and peppers made it seem like the perfect healthy option! The butter cake on the other hand is NOT a healthy option, but definitely NOTEWORTHY! OMG!! Eat as many butter cakes as you can.  -Service- For a group of nearly 10, our waitress held it down. She was friendly, attentive, and got everyone's order correct. She also recommended the ghastly butter cake, that is given me nightmares of being in a  CPK that discontinued it off their menu. Otherwise, CPK never fails. #proudcpkfan

I love the new remodeling arrangements! it looks so much nicer. Melanie our waitress was just wonderful and such a high spirited person! Only complaint was the music was a little loud and no more tiramisu :(

Tai chicken pizza with fresh veggies. Green onions, carrots, and a killer peanut sauce make this non greasy pizza killler with a unique flavor profile I'be haven't had in a while. Wife had tequila lime chicken pasta that was great too. Even the bread and olive oil was great.  Service from David (day shift Sunday) was outstanding. Just a great experience that wasn't expected. We'll be back shortly for more good food and service!  Valeting the car is $7.00 but what the hell. You don't have to do it.  Great experience today!

They have great staff. There was no wait to be seated. We got a great roomy table. Just how we like it. Our order came by really quick. The food was great. Nice and hot. I forgot the name of our server but he was awesome. If you download the Pizza Dough rewards app you can get $10 off and a free small plate.

Stopped in for lunch , Friday at 12:40pm  Place was packed but in a good way we were seated quickly and our order was taken fast , took a little while for the bread to come out , but I understand since the restaurant was packed  Food was good as always  Today I did the classic crispy chicken and the loaded baked potato soup , which was a first for me , and let me tell you it was amazing , really a good hearty , enjoyed stopping into to CPK for a quick lunch with my ain't and my son , food and service was great .

Been coming here since day one and yesterday was not one of their better moments.  Came before noon rush while there was plenty of seating.  But the hostess spent a few moments deciding where to seat me.  I'm glad they're back to offering bread but it came after my soup and seconds before my meal.  I guess they're having major plumbing issues because there was a port a potty at the end of the patio.  Food was okay.

This review is for curbside take out only. Basically this CPK blows. That's as simply as I can put it. Now let me explain... Thursday afternoon long day at work I'm off and craving a Thai crunch salad from CPK. If you haven't had it you are missing out. Want to get home already but I'm hungry so figured I'd try their curbside take out service .  Call#1 My initial call to place my order, thinking this is the only call I would need. Ordering a salad shouldn't be rocket science. Anyways, I called and the guy I spoke with took my order, asked if I wanted to add this or that or try that too blah blah blah. I said no thank you and was about to hang up thinking we were done when he all of a sudden said that he would rather transfer me to their take out "department" and have me place my order. I'm thinking...ok that's fine but why did you take my order in the first place? Call#2 I've arrived and Im curbside so I call to let them know. Only to have my order taken again because they lost my order and nothing is ready. This is the third time I hear about the new avocado egg rolls and if I want them added to my order. For the third f'ing time no thank you I don't want to add any avocado egg rolls so please shove the avocado egg rolls somewhere where the sun don't shine. If I wanted some god damn avocado egg rolls I would call and order some from sushi boy! In the end, I parked where I wasn't supposed to because there was nowhere else to park, got yelled at by the valet, ( chill dude I need 5 minutes and it's not like you really need my space when there are 15 other ones available) and marched inside to get a salad that's is absolutely delicious but shouldn't take all this to get. Yes I got the salad. Yes is was frustrating. Get it together CPK!  Would I go through this again to get the Thai chicken salad of my dreams? Probably but I'm not happy about it :).

My favorite is their Chopped Barbecue Chicken salad and Strawberry Shortcake for dessert. I wish I lived in the delivery area because I would have it delivered to me all the time. I shop at the mall often so I either sit down or get food to go before I leave but I usually have good service when I go. Only once did I have a bad experience and they gave me a discount for the trouble.

I really like this place and always have have good experiences . This time around was slightly different what i ordered didn't come out how I would have liked it .  but the reason why I'm writing a positive review is the way it was handled. Thanks again to Jessica for continually making my experience enjoyable.

This location is located in the South Bay Galleria. I believe that they remodeled their whole place and it's very pretty. We came in on a Thursday night for dinner. It wasn't very busy so my parents and I were promptly seated.  We ordered The Works pizza and chicken lettuce wraps. The pizza was okay, not a very big fan of it :( There was nothing special about it. I thought the chicken lettuce wraps were good though! The sauce they serve it with is a bit salty though... especially if you use too much. I was afraid that I would run out of chicken before lettuce cups so I tried to ration the 2. However, I ended up with more chicken than lettuce cups LOL. I'm not complaining though! The servers were all really nice. However, the service was really slow. It took us a long time to get our food :(

I had the worst service I  ever had at kpc. I have been going here for years and this Antonio had to be the worst waiter ever. He would ask us a question then leave without the answer. Ask us if we want bread then not bring it. He seems to be in such a hurry that he can't provide basic service. When we sat down there was someone's check at our table and he refused to take it!  I don't know what's going on in kpc but I won't be back after this horrible service! Too many other good places to go to.

Today myself and my colleague stopped by this CPK location for lunch and we were not satisfied with the service we received. We were seated at 12:24pm and did not receive our food until well after 1:10pm. I understand the kitchen can get backed up BUT when you notice someone that has came in AFTER you receiving there food, that's when it becomes an issue!  We ordered lunch specials (in which are small meals) and the couple that came in AFTER us but was served BEFORE us ordered full entrées. This couple came in about 15 mins after us and ordered after the waitress took our orders. (I know because our table was right behind there's) This couple received there food at least 10mins before we did. We were literally sitting there watching them eat. The waitress came over to tell us she was sorry for the long wait due to a large party in which I didn't understand what the large party had to do with us! And furthermore if we had to wait for our orders how come the couple that came in AFTER us had received there food? The majority of customers were caucasian and we, myself African American and my colleague Hispanic felt we pushed aside and had to deal with it. It had gotten to the point I asked for a manager and right before he came our food was brought out. I told him that was ok; however he and the waitress knew I was VERY upset. My pizza wasn't freshly hot (not sure if it was just sitting back there). At this point I was over it. We asked for our checks.. On my bill I saw a credit for $10 as if I was there by myself. He (my colleague) was there too experiencing this with me. Why was I only credited $10 and he not be entitled the same?  There was 2 other African American women across from us that had been waiting for sometime and they were there when we were being seated. You start to wonder when everyone caucasian around you are being served and attended to in a timely matter and you/others of different races aren't.  I absolutely love CPK and I often visit the location in Downtown LA near our office, we never had a problem.. They treat there customers so nice. We were in the area and stopped by and this location was beyond me. I didn't like the feeling of feeling like we had to just deal with it. We are customers like everyone else!

I went today(August 22) for brunch at their opening time 11:00 am. When my server(Sara) came, she asked what drinks I wanted and I said water. She came back and brought and I said I was ready to order at 11:10 am. I only ordered pizza and she brought it at 11:45. After waiting that long, she NEVER even offered bread. We were only like 5 tables who were there. Also, she never came back to check or ask how's everything. When my friend came in, she ordered flatbread, it took another 30 minutes for just the flatbread. She also never refilled our drinks. She only came back to the table when we wave at her for the check.I think that deserves a Zero tip.

I used LABite to deliver dinner tonight. All the food was great!  I want to compliment the perfect California Cobb Salad. Every ingredient was fresh, perfectly cut/chopped & beautifully arranged. This will sound odd to some, but I really appreciated the DRY lettuce!  Most meal salads ( especially in a to go order) are made with drippy wet lettuce. This salad was absolutely perfect.

I eat here often and enjoy the food . I choose this location mainly because the manager (Jessica ) . I always see her making her rounds on the floor checking on each and every table to make sure that the customer dining is satisfied . I have to say it makes a big difference when you know there is someone that is running a restaurant that CARES  if you are totally satisfied. In my experience if anything may not totally satisfy u like Luke warm appetizers. Jessica completely took it off our bill and brought out a fresh hot plate of food on the house. I only know her name because after so many times of going to this CPK and being satisfied I had to call and ask . I recommend if in the area to stop in and have a bite . You won't be disappointed especially if Jessica is the manager on the floor .  I work so I only go around the same time weekdays after 5 . I haven't had a bad experience to post .  Happy dining !

The Manager Leon told me that he would mail me a gift card for 2 free dinners for all of the heartache that I experienced on this visit. That was 8/13/15 and to date, 9/23/15 I have received nothing from CPK. I even responded to the email that he sent me with no response.
As always we enjoy eating at CPK and this one is not a disappointment....:) FYI...it's not were yelp shows it.  It's at the entrance to the mall.

Antonio was our server today..... greeted fast and seated fast must be because is a monday......on the menu we ordered half of the Italian cooped salad.....tequila chicken pasta..... and pizza..... everything is clean and the air conditioner is perfect

Am I supposed to pay a premium because, a long time ago, celebrity chef Wolfgang Puck cared about this chain? I hope not! Food varied from bad to ok.  - The small plates are SMALL. Ordered the quesadilla for my 2-year old and it was a street taco size tortilla with little to no filling. It wasn't enough for even him to eat. Pretty pricy for a cracker... - Another SMALL plate, the quac and chips didn't have much avocado in it - more than half of it was filler corn :/ - We ended up having to order a kids meal and the mac is runny. Was this on purpose to kids don't eat too much cheese? - Kung Pao Shrimp Noodles was ok.  Service was excellent. We had a server who checked in frequently, other staff stopped by to say hi to our child (maybe we have a cute kid or they had time to kill as the place was far from empty?).  The restaurant is well lit, well decorated, open, bright and clean. If only the food was better and a better value.

I've only been here a couple times and it's never anything spectacular. The most recent I came with some girlfriends from yoga and someone opened the door for us and the hostess seated us right away. Our server was nice and dealt with us being indecisive in the beginning so thank you for that! We ordered an appetizer for the table at the same time as our regular order and our food came out first, which was run by I think the manager(s)? It was two ladies. When we asked about the appetizer (mac n cheese) she questioned if we wanted to order it which was fine she doesn't know we already did so we let her know and she continuously asks us if it's the mac n cheese BITES and we're like "I don't know whatever the mac n cheese is, we already ordered it" and again she's like "BITES?" omg we don't know, it's on the order, just check sheesh. Then another lady that also looks like manager asks if she can "borrow" the balsamic, which she never brought back but whatever. We finally get the bites and they look either burnt or sitting under the heat lamp too long.. it's just 4 bites on top of cheese sauce.. nothing exciting. No one came to ask if we needed anything else, like cheese and pepper since three of us got pizza. And our server only came once to refill our water which had been empty for some time now. I really did like her though and she was nice enough to take three cards for the bill. There was just some confusion with the order I guess and no one checked on us, just dropped off our food.

Only reason this place deserve 2 stars because their food was decent. Honestly service was horrible. I didn't even know who was my server than manager took my plate gave me the bill and than I was sitting there so someone can charge me and a girl was walking back-and-forth ignoring me. So finally I called them told them to charge me so they did than I left.

I'd say that I frequent this spot often enough. It's always good, but nothing really never stands out. Today was QUITE different. Total remodel job. Service was remarkable. Restaurant looks amazing with a more "open" feel to it. They've also brought back the "shrimp scampi pizza". I wasn't sure about it and ended up ordering the roasted garlic chicken. Didn't like the chicken as much and guess what...they changed it to the pizza that I wanted. The shrimp was AMAZING!  Completely full of flavor with a small red chili kick!!  Highly recommended!
Worst service I've ever had, they ruin my diner and movie  plans. waited for 20 minutes to place an order

Doug the waiter is amazing & friendly!! My hubby and I came for our first time. We ordered the crispy mac and cheese which was devine. It was 4 oval shape fried crispy outside and mac and cheese on the inside.  We also ordered the shrimp scampi pizza. Its a cheesy pizza with shrimp, arugula and baked onions. Thank you for hiring nice people and having yummy food!!

Ok...if i could give no stars...I would Ever since this location was renovated....the service has declined exponentially. Last 2-3 times my family ate here...the food took FOREVER to be served...its Pizza...Pasta...not Rump Roast...no excuse for food of this style to take over 30+ minutes. Tonight my wife called in a to go/ curbside order(we've done this a hundred times over the 15 years we've lived in this area) I called to let them know I was outside one minute after the time they had told my wife our food would be ready for pick up...Juan let me know they would be "right out with my food" 20 minutes later I called to see where my food was??? The girl who answered the phone told me they had no to go orders under my name or any of the dish's my wife ordered where on their "to go" list...she put me on hold and then the call got "disconnected"??? The girl then came out to my car....with a smile...letting me know they did not have my order and subsequently...did not have my food...I asked to her to get the manager  Manager comes out...i explain what has transpired and she launches into a dialogue about the mechanics of how their "to go/ curbside order" call center works etc...like I care...Then she commented that Juan was not on "to go" duty tonight...i asked why hell was he answering the phones then?!?!...she smirked...I'm glad my question entertained her...
