I called another local chain restaurant " Luciles" and damn skippy not only did they have my order 100% correct but it was ready when I arrived...imagine that...a establishment with competent employee's who understand their job and provide excellent service with a smile...  I hope someone from CPK reads this review...my family of 4 loves the food there and we eat there at least every 4-6 weeks...but never again....will this company see a penny from my family.... maybe CPK as a brand is on the way out..this particular location is at the South Bay Galleria Mall...just a few miles north of the newly renovated state of the art luxury Del Amo mall...where there is no CPK...but there certainly is a Luciles ...and a new Luciles that is 3 times larger than the current Luciles is opening soon at the new Del Amo mall....read the writing on the wall CPK...invest in better employee's and less "reclaimed" barn wood for your decor and you might have a chance at not loosing more customers.

Came here on October 21, 2015 for the first time at this location. Our waitress made great conversation with us, and took our orders right away. The staff here is awesome and they make great recommendations, as well as accommodations. My date and I had a great time, and the beer is awesome. Thank you to the staff and management. Love the decor and atmosphere. Great place to be during the week! Xoxo CPK

last night, i ate here with my HIH/HRH bf and his mom for dinner.  customer service was very nice and friendly but when it came to my dish of their spaghetti, the food gave me a VERY upset stomach all night long as soon as i got home and all through the night.  I could not sleep well at all. having to make so many countless trips to the bathroom.  their pasta or tomato sauce must've been expired or/dirty without the chefs doing anything about to throw those ingredients out. this is a health issue and this branch management needs to go into their kitchen and see if all the food are up to date. starting NOW.  if not, i will contact the health department. because this is not proper business within your kitchen to make your client(s) ill.  this has never happened to me before.  and the only time my stomach is very upset like this is when the food is dirty/gone bad.  this is a living/awake nightmare to go through what i went through. i am missing my work day today to remain home and in bed because i do not feel good. thank you cpk, i will give you my doctor's bill and you can pay for it since you have made me ill.

I have been here many times.  My experiences have been different every single time from good to bad.  When I came here the last time it was for a fundraiser for my sons school. Our sever was Doug.  He was AWESOME!!! My son and I both ordered salads and we asked for them to be brought out first and they were.  I have been here before and for some reason they can never bring the salads out first.  Doug was friendly and interacted with my son which is a step most servers forget, THE KIDS!!!!  Doug checked on us many times and brought the bill and returned quickly with the change.  I will go back again and ask for Doug, I just hope he stays there.  In my experience most great servers like Doug move on.  I really hope he is there when we go back.  If you go ask to sit in his section and don't forget to order the red velvet cake :)

This location is quite possibly the restaurant with the worst customer service in the world! To start off, I never like to name any server's name out in public, but Jesus was down right awful. Although we were seated immediately and our order was taken pretty quickly, the wait time for the food, especially appetizers, was pitiful.  We ordered the chips with avocado, a Bianco flatbread, and the chopped bbq chicken salad. The appetizer never even arrived. It took more than 30 minutes into our meal when we began to wonder if the appetizer was ever ordered by Jesus to begin with. We flagged down Jesus, who insisted that he placed the order, never once remedying our impatience but rather being insistent that he placed the order correctly.  When the stupid flatbread finally arrived it was disgustingly wet, drenched in oil, and overly salty. Our glasses of water sat empty the entire time. Once again we flagged Jesus to fill our waters please! Come check time, they were quick to drop us off our bill. We patiently sat and waited for someone to collect our money and no one came. I got up and stood next to the cash register while server after server after server carelessly walked past me without ever asking if I needed help. Mind you, it was 10pm and each and every one of them were too focused on drying the cups, wiping down the tables and silverware to make sure that they can leave on time. But hey, what about me?! I'm the customer here. Finally, the manager sees me and I wave for her to come and cash me out. She walks over and while apologetic, offered no remediation. I pretty much lost all respect for this establishment after tonight's debacle. What a shit poor place CPK has turned into.  You can't even get an appetizer out on time. You bring out my entree first and when I'm just about ready to cancel my appetizer, you magically make it appear! You can't fill my empty water cup. You can't cash out my check without having me get up and search for an available person to cash me out.  Overall, you guys suck.

Great food best cpk ever been to great staff funny server made me feel at home and by far even the cocktails taste better here  Manager was curious friendly professional guy .. I belief his name was Leon  great job in this cpk must come especially after long day of shopping

Visited this location on a busy night during the holidays. Servers were slammed, which is understandable, but they brought out our soup and salads and entrees all at the same time, overwhelming the table and making it hard to eat.  Even worse, the noise level in this restaurant was painful- loud, blasting music reverberated off the concrete floors and glass windows. Our party of 6 had to shout to hear one another and eventually gave up. The food is good- get it to go unless you enjoy dining at rock concert decibel levels.

Came in here on a Friday night at 6:30, very friendly hostess! Quotes 20 minutes but only waited about 10. They were very busy when we walked in and slowed down at 7:30 when we left. Service was attentive our waitress was Chelsey!! very attentive always had a smile. Cocktails took a bit about 10 minutes but everything else was properly on time. Even got the remainder of my Margarita pizza to go. 2 Managers were also floating around mostly behind the counter helping package to-go food but also saw them in the dinning room helping out which I am a big advocate about. One of them even asked how everything was going. Only downside but not to me but the family of 4 across from us sat for about 15 minutes without any service but one of the managers took the order and took care of them hope it wasn't our waitresses section "woops"? ill be back my wife loves the salad here. Also digging the new wood/chalkboard design going on here.

Ehhh food was good crispy mac was not even cheesy but the mushroom pizza was good and my mini me said the Hawaiian was "delicious" but the service was slow and part of the order was forgotten. She comped that part (which helped, but still didn't make up for it) overall I'd come back but just for take out. I understand it's dinner time but it's Thursday not even the weekend yet so I can't really put it on that. Idk it was a so-so experience I guess. I take it back. Just got my check back (after having to take it up to the manager to ring it up for me) and was charged double the amount why? Oh because he charged someone else's receipt to mine. I won't be coming back at all. I'll go to another location if EVER I have the craving (doubt it).

Very slow service ..everyone seems to be ready to go home it's Friday night:) restaurant closes at 11pm I walked in at 10 pm and my food was served at 10:44pm and no utensils so another 15 minutes wait to get utensils...word of advice:do not go to CPK locations like this as you will just get the treatment based on area you are in:) unless you are used to such treatment even after paying decent amount for your food... Definitely worst CPK I have ever been to

Ordered food on line with 6:45 pm pick up time, allowing more than 45 minutes to prepare.  Got there at 6:50 pm had to wait another 20 minutes, when I got the food, it was cold and the bread I requested was another 15 minute wait. The Staff was working hard and trying their best, by the looks at the faces of the diners and there empty tables, it look like a Management problem, not the Staff. I will now go to the other location in Manhattan Beach.  Don't waste your time !!!

I like this place but for the price they charge, food quality, portions and service have declined over the years.  The menu has somewhat changed but nothing earthshaking.  I still miss the Mandarin Duck pizza and happy that the Kung Pao spaghetti is still there but there isn't much to be excited about anymore.  The servers look harried, and service is spotty, tells you that they are more concerned about controlling costs.  Worth a visit once in a while just to see what's new but I suggest to take your money and check out what a new hole in the wall eatery has to offer.

1/27/2016 First time to this location we usually go to the one in Manhattan and I must say it wasnt bad partially because there weren't that many people here today. We got here and our waiter Doug sat us down and took our order. We had a BBQ chicken pizza and a Caesars salad. 13 minutes later our food came our fresh and hot! We would like to thank our waiter Doug for the excellent service! Parking is also very convenient due to the fact that it's located next to the mall!

Honestly I'm not the biggest CPK fan and was a little bummed when my friends decided to go there but .... To my surprise I had a good experience .. the manager Lateif was extremely nice. He originally came to check on our table, but then we had a few questions for him about the menu and Resturant. (Nothing bad) He informed us of new items (as well as old) on the menu, and even suggested with confidence that we try them.  Speaking with him made our dinning experience very delightful. Especially since we didn't even think about how long it took our food to come out because we were having a pleasant conversation with the manager. Everyone enjoyed their food and we also learned great things about CPK and the brand.  I wish we could've tipped the manager ! He was great. He exemplified exactly how a manager should interact with his customers. I would have wrote this review on the CPK customer site but I misplaced my receipt. !!! So I guess I loss out on the chance to win $500 lol . Oh well

Overcooked salmon and cold rib eye. When we sent steak back, they re-cooked the same piece and brought it back. Obviously the manager on duty doesn't know first thing about food or customer service. Will not return to this location.  We eat at their Rolling Hills location all the time and they are much much better.

My husband and I have been to this place a couple of times and we have always had a great time here. Whenever we have a trouble deciding where to go, we head to this CPK and always leave feeling happy about our experience. They have really nice servers and I can't remember a single time we came out saying the food didn't taste good or the server was rude. Keep up the good work :)

Good sensible food very tasty great service, so many choices so many good things we tried this flat bread with brussel sprouts and bacon it was delicious we also tried a new salad the Thai crunch also a thumbs up.

I haven't been to a CPK in like 5 years. Finally got my husband to try this with me. I promised a great experience and he was not convinced.  We ordered avocado roll apps, delicious! Cobb salad, super salty and they forgot dressing. Ate half the salad before they got around to brining it by. Ordered the works pizza. It was cold and obviously overcooked! I had to say something and waiter consulted with manager and they offered to make it again. My husband was silent and fuming that a simple pizza was not done right. New pizza came and honesty yes it was hot but the sausage was cold? How is that possible? Did they reuse old toppings? Anyway the pizza was nothing special and it might as well have been frozen store bought pizza.  Service was just ok, nothing to really sing about. Food was a disappointment except for the avocado rolls. I was really hoping to make this a new Friday night spot but that won't happen since my husband never wants to step foot in this place lol. Too bad CPK

My review is more on service than food:  Came here for lunch on a weekend and wasnt too happy with the service. Walked in and left our names with the hostess who told us it would be about a 15 minute wait. She was seating others that were ahead of us and at the same time others were walking in leaving their name. A family who left their names after us all of a sudden I notice the hostess called her over and sat the family down. Then the hostess decided to take us to a booth that was in the back and on our way i saw so many other available booths that were not being used. So fine, we sat down and it took almost 10 minutes for someone to finally ask us if we wanted drinks. Ordered the drinks and food since we didnt want to wait another long time to get them to come back and take our order. Food was good just the service was a bit slow and off. It wasnt so busy that people were running around just an off day maybe ? The waiters I notice tried to make up for the lack of service by being extra friendly. Appreciative of that.

I generally love CPK. Good food, nice ambiance, and good service. This place is the exception. This is the second time I have dined here with my family and the service has been subpar. We came for lunch with my kids and my friend and her kids midweek. The place was not crowded at all. Our waitress took forever to come around and then we placed the children's orders first. Granted, we asked a couple of questions and took about 5-10 mins longer to order the adult menus, but the kids food came out, was all eaten and we were still waiting for our food more than 20 minutes later. We were never able to track down our waitress. Three times my friend had to get up and go to the hostess table to try and find someone to help us when we needed another drink or extra plates and utensils. That is unacceptable. Finally, the kids had finished their food and were starting to act up when I got really upset and worried about their safety and other customers experiences so I asked for our food to be wrapped up to go. You would think at that point that they would rush to help us get our food to go and apologize or maybe offer to try to help us in some way. But you would be wrong. It still took another 10 minutes for our food to be wrapped up to go. Mind you we did not order pizza - simply two salads (which I'm sure is bulk prepared in advance), chicken potstickers (which are clearly nuked up from frozen), and a soup (probably in large pots in the back). No pizzas that would take time to be prepared in their oven. There was just no reason it should have taken so long. Plus when I complained to our waitress she gave me attitude instead of apologizing. Really? I will take my heard earned money elsewhere from now on.
Amazing how receptive people are even while receiving diplomatic critical feedback.  Way to go CPK!

Delish!! This place really improved on their menu and ambience! My sister and I have been there twice in the past month since we were craving their yummy food. We had the white corn guacamole....omgosh it's the best best best!!!  We had the Waldorf and Cobb salads, and we ate every little bite!  My iced tea had plenty of ice! It was wonderful!  Our server was fast and friendly. I think her name was Sarah, but not sure.  We left an extra tip because we were so delighted to enjoy a lovely lunch!!!  My grade A++++++++++++++++!!!  Highly recommend!!  YUM!!

I just love the Dakota split pea soup here... I never go wrong when I order it. All the pizza's are very good too. I'm not sure what it is but I can easily eat a whole pizza here at this establishment. The crust is crunchy and yet chewy and it doesn't weigh you down. Two of my favorites are the barbecue chicken and their garlic chicken pizza. An added plus is that they are now serving different kinds of Sangria's which all have been delicious thus far.

I ordered curbside takeout. When I arrived I called inside and was put on hold for over 10 minutes.. I drove off and called back to cancel my order. The  employee that answered apologized and asked could she have my name and number and a manager would call me back. A manager by the name of Izby called me back and was very rude. He went back and forth with me saying I couldn't have called. I should have just went to Manhattan Beach where they are more friendly and professional. I will never waste my time or spend money at this particular location again.

I LOVE CALIFORNIA PIZZA KITCHEN. What I order.... and havent changed over 10 years... 1. Chicken Tequila Pasta 2. Chicken Waldorf Salad (half or full plate) 3. Chipotle Pizza I get these always.  everyone I come eat here with... they don't get another choice.. this is what we are ordering... nothing else needs to be said.  This would feed 2-4 people.

I ordered the Penne Pasta with shrimp. What a waste of money, $18.57 worth of crap. I couldve made this better with a jar from the store. The noodles were hard, dry and stuck together. There was hardly any sauce, no flavor and like 5 pieces of shrimp. Really????!!!! Im gonna stick with Papa Guidos in Redondo. Better flavor, bigger helpings and better prices. Yuck so disappointed with CPK. Im gonna eat a piece of pizza better.

This 5 star review is for our waitress AERIS....SHE WAS FANTASTIC!!!  We had an issue with one of our dishes. She went over and above to fix the problem. Aeris was so sweet and super polite! She made our visit to CPK a great one!!  Thank you Aeris!!! Best service I've ever experienced!

Stopped by here earlier today with my little girl. I give this place 3 stars not bc I enjoyed eating the food but simply bc our waiter didn't charge us for our meals. My daughters Mac n cheese came first but they mistakenly added 'cilantro' , then mine came (10 min later) I ordered the 'Thai Crunch Salad' and the rice sticks were stale. So pretty much sums it up. The waiter was very nice and provided exceptional great customer service. We may come back in the future and try other things from their menu.

I love CPK and their Chinese Chicken Salad and thats pretty much what i always get. I walk in and get seated. Oh, it's just me btw. I sat there for 15 minutes and i had numerous waitresses walk by and make eye contact with all of them. Yet, none stopped to ask if i even needed water. So i decided to walk up to the front and just simply let them know that i had been sitting down and nobody cared to assist me. This hispanic lady said she would go check the table but i kindly told her that i was leaving and thank you.  Wow. Cant believe CPK had such bad service tonight. I really wanted a Chinese Chicken Salad. Im pretty mad about that now.

Kudos to our waiter Chris on 6/17, kept it fun and personable on a busy night, always let us know the status of our order and remembered everything we asked for! We've come here for many years for the wide variety of food to accommodate lots of different food preferences.  Prices have increased over time but it's like everywhere else.  I usually get the California Veggie pizza, which I love, but this time I tried the Thai chicken pizza.  I was worried it was going to be too spicy -- it had a little kick but mostly lots of flavor, so I was relieved.  (If you like spicy food, it will not be spicy enough for you -- you won't even taste it.)  Food can be on the salty side, like the creamy pastas and stuff. The real strong point is the wonderful chewy free bread appetizer, and especially the wonderful olive oil dip that comes with it -- it is amazing.  If you ever wondered what to do with the thick pizza crust left in your hand after you eat the part with the toppings, just dip it in that olive oil, yum!

I normally love CPK but my experience today made me not want to come back. Not only did it take them 20 minutes to acknowledge we were there but our server didn't bring us our full order, didn't come back once to ask us for refills or if we need anything. To top off the bad experience we had to wait an additional 15 minutes just to get the check and when no one came we had to get up and ask for it and we still waited to get our card back yet another 15 minutes.

On the outskirts of the Galleria in Torrance, this California Pizza Kitchen location is ideal and convenient for mall patrons and people looking for a nice sit down meal. Like any CPK, the service is fair and it is definitely worth the price for a quality pizza. The best times to come in are usually during lunch hours (11:30 AM - 2 PM) since availability is pretty much open.  Since I've been here, they've expanded their traditional menu to more family friendly and healthy options like salads, artisanal dishes, seafood, and poultry options. Whether you're feeling like a pizza, pasta dish, or something completely new, CPK hosts a variety of wonderful menu options that will fill you up nicely.

This review is for this particular location- Went this evening around 7ish to have dinner with the bf. We asked for a table and were told 5 mins and well 15 mins later we were seated and told our waiter would come and take our order shortly.  It's Sunday evening and a busy day for dinner so we understand there is a wait involved. But the minutes passed and no waiter had come buy to even offer drinks. We continued waiting...by now we had been seated for 20 mins or so. And after seeing two other parties that came after us being taken care of we decided to walk out. If your in the Food Service industry. There are two vital requirements Good Food & Good Service! Unfortunately we were on the Bad Service receiving end this evening. We didn't even get to taste a glass of water so  couldn't review the food even if I wanted to. Nonetheless we didn't let our bad experience ruin our evening...went to dinner elsewhere and ended the night at our favorite ice cream place, Handel's Ice Cream. Now that is a place where regardless of the lines or time of day the service is always great.

A friend and I went to have dinner at the California Pizza Kitchen in the South Bay Galleria on Saturday, July 24, at around 5:00 pm.  We ordered a Thai Salad, Thai Pasta, and a Strawberry drink.  After we ordered, about 20 minutes go by and the waitress brought us some bread.  We gabbed and laughed while we waited.  We were hungry and we were still waiting for at least our salad as 40 minutes went by, the waitress says "oh it's almost ready" - well, we have been waiting for an hour, I go to talk to the manager and he is on the phone and I wait 5 more minutes.  Finally, I told him that we have been waiting for an hour for our food and we haven't received it yet, so we are leaving, he says "oh sorry" - the waitress says ok, I'll be right back, and she comes back with my check for $3.86 for my drink!  REALLY!  What horrible service from the snot nose manager and bad waitress!
Had Door Dash deliver food. Order over $100 and they sent me 2 pieces of bread.  Really.  And yes the pick up was at the Redondo Beach location

We love CPK! The service at this one is quick, and we usually go on Sunday nights and have the same server. Is his name Doug? Anyway, he's awesome and the food is always good. Love the free bread they give you in the beginning, and they have some good craft cocktails. We've never had a bad experience here!

Came here today to celebrate my grandma's birthday. Service and food were both excellent! We were served bread and dipping oil while waiting for our meals to be served. I got the roasted veggie salad which is pretty much the only thing I ever order here. My grandma got the tostada pizza and my sister the pear & Gorgonzola pizza which are both delicious! Then we ordered two desserts to celebrate! I'm not really a dessert person, but these were FIRE! We got the salted caramel pudding and the butter cake. The butter cake was served hot with ice cream on top. All 3 of us were definitely satisfied from these desserts.

Typical CPK and I mean that in a good way. There are plenty of options on the menu so I'll break my review down by my mood for the day. If I'm in the mood for something heavier I order the garlic cream fettuccini with chicken and mushrooms.  The chicken and mushrooms are an extra fee and FYI sometimes they don't put enough for the amount you pay. But I will say it always comes out very delicious.  If I want something lighter, I order the zucchini and shrimp pasta (off their light menu).  The zucchini is is cut into strips similar to pasta so you end up with lots of zucchini and a little pasta. Also super yummy!  But my fave thing here is their Tuscan hummus with traditional pita... Not healthy my any stretch of the imagination, but it's so freaking addicting. :-/. The only thing I had a little issue with recently was that I called at 9:05pm to put in a take out order (they close at 10pm) and they basically told me they couldn't take a phone order. How weird is that?! So the employee said "you can come in to make a to-go order"... Not exactly sure how that is any different than taking the order over to phone to save me time... If they close at 10pm then they should be taking orders until that time. That was annoying.  But other than that one annoying situation, I've had good experiences here.

Staff I really nice. Food is really good and you can tell that they put a lot of effort into it. I don't have a lot to say  but this is a really good location and I do recommend eating here with friends.

Had pleasant evening here.  Located outside of the South Bay Galleria Mall is this CPK which offers valet parking. Parking is free next to valet so no need for valet. I was surprised how empty CPK is for dinner time. There were few groups of people.  I was with a group of 4 and we got to our seats quickly. We got free bread while waiting. It was warm and the dipping sauce is olive oil with seasoning. We ordered artichoke dip appetizer. It was delicious! You must try! Tortilla with warm dipping sauce!  My friends got pasta and I got pizza. The pasta came in a large plate which was not necessary. The portion is average portion but plate was huge! Too huge! My pizza was big and really filling. I ordered the wild mushroom pizza. It was about 9-10inches in diameter. It was really delicious however the bread/crust lacked oil. The bread was floury and didn't have that golden brown look to a pizza.   Overall i would recommend coming here if you want to eat American food that tastes really good. Price is high but the food is really good.
The service was terrible. It took forever to get drink refills. Our macaroni bites came out cold. It was not a good experience.

I am always satisfied when I go to any CPK and I like the layout and vibe of this location in particular but I've never been one to seek out this restaurant - until now.  They have some great changes overall with new additions to their menu, their choice of bread served before the meal has been upgraded (as has the dipping sauce)! But there are two things that will get me in here right away.  Tonight I strayed from my favorite pizzas and had the seasonal offering Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti. It was beautiful and flavorful (in a nutty and meaty sort of way). Just the right amount of sauce and an abundance of mushrooms!  I can't wait to get that again soon!   The other thing I hope to return to try was a server recommendation. She said the buffalo roasted cauliflower was amazing! I love buffalo anything AND roasted cauliflower!  Be in soon! For those with kids - they have good size portions for those of us with kids about to age out of the special menu!  My tween couldn't even finish her meal! The meat sauce fusilli had a mild but flavorful tomato sauce on it. It nicely accented the meat in the sauce without overbearing it.  CPK has upped its game and I've noticed and appreciated their efforts!

I love this place, since I can't eat lettuce I improvise on the California Cobb Salad. I order it with no lettuce, basil, chicken, and bacon. It comes with tomatoes, extra chopped eggs, and beets. And then add corn, black and garbanzo beans, Monterey Jack, Rice Sticks or Tortilla Strips and Bleu Cheese Crumbles and for dressings Thai Peanut Sauce(Spicy with no Cilantro), Blue Cheese, and Balsamic Vinaigrette . Enjoy, I love it and I order it often. The Management and Staff are great. There hummus is good too!! If you decide to try the salad that Linda sent you. I also like to add Bleu  Cheese Crumbles to the Sedona Tortilla Soup as well.

My food took 30 mins to come out and was room temperature. Not even hot. She asked if I wanted sauce, as if that would solve my problem. Not satisfied.  Just recieved "fresh" cooked pasta. Still cold, noodles undercooked, and surprise, it's exactly the same pasta I just ate. My bitten pieces were still there. Was too obvious.

I am spoiled by the exceptional service and food quality at the Manhattan Beach location so I must speak out here. I am a regular and quite often disappointed with the portion sizes of the to go salads. I order and pay for a full size so I can share it. The portion seems like a half size. I should know better. It's worth the drive to the Manhattan Village location.
Really used to like this place until something shady happened to charges on my debit card.. make sure to check your bank statements after eating here.
Good food but you can only be burned by bad service so many times before you give up. That's where I'm at. This particular location has really bad service.
Fish tacos got a small pieces in it.  They didn't gave us any bread. And why do they calculate the tip after tax? You don't give tip on tax. Actually tip should still be for the good service

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! My friend and I went to CPK on 1/2/2017. Everything was ok until we got seated. As my friend & I were sitting and waiting on our waiter waitress, it took her (Katherine) almost a good 15 mins to come over and take our order. Once our order was taken, I looked around the restaurant we noticed that everyone had rolls at their table except for us. Another group of people were seated and they immediately received their rolls and drinks while we were waiting on ours. I had to call the waiter over to our table and ask her what happened to our rolls? She said "oh she forgot!" so then she came back with our rolls. Then we ordered our food. Our food came, Katherine the waitress asked if we wanted parmesan cheese? I told her yes. As she was grading the cheese, the cheese was flying everywhere, all over my clothes and table. As we were eating the waitress NEVER came back to check on us. By this time, I was irritated. We had finished our drinks, we didn't get a refill, it was like she was avoiding us for some reason. Because I was irritated I asked my friend if she can call her over to get a refill for our drinks. My friend calls her over, she only refilled one drink. NEVER once asked is there anything else she could do? Or if we needed anything? So we finished eating & now we're waiting to pay for our food. We waited  for almost 30 mins or more for her to come get our check. By this time, I got up and asked to speak with a manager, because this was ridiculous. i went over and spoke with the manager, who was handling another complaint at the time. Overall the experience that we received from our waitress was HORRIBLE!!!! The WORST customer service EVER!!!!
Worst service.  I watched my salad i ordered to go sit while the hostess took four orders

Ok the two star review is for the kitchen taking over half and hour to serve our half salad and sandwich. Our server Chris was very attentive and is not at fault, we got our soups, bread and appetizers quickly but had to wait for our main entrees. The manager; young male did not check on us once and seen us waiting for our main entrees. Very disappointed since we are regular customers. Time frame is 3:30-4:30pm. Sunday 1-07-16

The way I love their bread and oil!  The Redondo Beach location has the best service out of all the locations I've been too (Brentwood, Manhattan, Culver City and Marina Del Rey).  I love their BLT pizza, and my mom does too.  Many CPKs no longer have it on their menu, but you can still order it at any location, since they have it in their computer system.  I've tried several of their pizzas, and some pasta dishes.  All are very well put together, except the mushroom pasta- it has no mushroom taste.  They should really use a higher quality of mushroom for a dish that is just mushrooms and pasta.  Otherwise, CPK really does have excellent food

Just left this place. My girlfriend and I came here to try out this place after we were given a free entree card from a friend. The personal sized pizzas are way overpriced ($16) and extremely disappointing. We got "the works" and it was just 3 pieces of pepperoni, 3 sausage pieces, too much bell pepper and mushrooms. The veggies on it were thrown on top raw and not seasoned nor cooked. The pizza took 20 minutes. It had no sauce whatsoever too. I mean I lifted up the choose and there was no red sauce anywhere. I literally thought we were given a frozen pizza. It was an extremely thin crust pizza but they had a selection of thin crust pizza which I imagine are paper thin because they couldn't have got any thinner than the original.  The pizza here is way over priced, thrown together worse than anything I've seen in regards to pizza, had no sauce, and took too long for what equaled a frozen pizza.   The waiter came to fill our glasses of water once over the 40 minutes we were there. That wasn't cool. The menu overall was way overpriced and I wouldn't advise anyone to come to CPK. This chain needs to learn how to make real pizzas that have sauce and at least cook the mushrooms with the pizza, not putting them on raw. Finally the pizza should cost you $5 at max. I'm extremely disappointed in this place, it just doesn't get worse than expecting a decent pizza to receiving a pizza put together by "chefs" who must not have any culinary skills.  Everything here is a disaster. The food, service, prices, and quality were considerably below sub-par to where I'd call it a poor franchise all around.  Surprised they haven't claimed bankruptcy yet.

I used to like this place- but not after my experience last week with the new manager. Clearly he never eaten CPKs jambalaya before. Well, I have been eating them for 15years. So I know exactly that the one they served me doesn't have crawfish and sausage. When I asked for it, the manager took my fork and he kept on digging my pasta plate like he was looking for a miracle of crawfish to appear. When he couldn't find any, he says that it was on the sauce. They I gave him the look, "yes" the look that he doesn't even know what he was talking about. Then he took my plate and throw some sausage and crawfish in there when my pasta is already cold and soggy. Because he gave me the exact same pasta the he was digging ten minutes ago! Thanks Manager! And of course, I won't be coming back!

I've been to CPK lots of times in all diffrent locations. But for some reason the one inside the galleria mall can never get it right. I usually just let little stuff slide but not tonight. I waited about 20 min in line at the "pickup" desk for my to go order and watched as the GM stood there and did nothing and watched the girl fumble and bumble orders and lagg on them and keep people waiting.  Then as she is about to ring me up he jumps on her register and decides to do some kinda of inventory before I can pay and get out of there. So my total was $19 and change so I just handed the girl a 20 and told her keep the change. I get home and the chicken on the salad is burned and has bacon and I ordered it without and my kids pasta is super under cooked. At this point I'm really tired and got all the way home. So now I go all the way back to return the food because it isn't hardly edible. I go in and speak to a manager and told them the problem with the food and get the usual "so sorry, I can make you a new order or would you like your money back?" Well....I don't feel like wasting another 30 min of my time and my family is already eating oatmeal now because they can't wait and so I'll take my money back. I get my money back and then what?   That's it? I don't like to ask for stuff or seem like I'm trying to get over on someone but when you ruin someone's family's saturday evening and waste almost an hour total of there time you should give them some kind of gift card or somthing to make up for that. " I'm sorry" isn't gonna fix that . I swear I'll never go back to that location again!

Came here today 01/27/17, and I have to say service was outstanding! Our dishes were delay and it was beginning to turn into a bad experience but luckily Mussa our sever was on top of the game. They comp our dishes and of top of that complimentary dessert. Thank you for making our stay unforgettable.

Horrible Horrible Horrible Service!!!!!  I was seated at 8.15pm, ordered my food at 8.17pm. Chicken lettuce wrap and Bbq chicken salad. I kept waiting and waiting. Finally at 8.50pm I gave up and left!!!  Horrible Service!!

Haven't been to this location in many years and it looks just the same, noise level is off the charts. We  shared a chopped salad one of us got the five cheese pizza and the other veggie no onions. Guess how the veggie pizza came out? With onions. Our waiter assured us he'd bring out the corrected right away. We waited at least 20 minutes, not happy. The pizzas were good as was the salad but the service and wait were not.

Curbside pickup is kind of lame. It'd be faster and less confusing just to go in. This is our second attempt at curbside since the first order we picked up was wrong, and came with a frozen salad. Didn't know until we got all the way home. They gave us gift cards to make up for the inconvenience, which is cool, but I probably won't order from here again. My current order was supposed to be ready at 6:54 and it's now 7:13. The lady just came out and said it's not ready yet, they are missing one thing. I only ordered two things so 50% of my order is almost 20 minutes late. Keep in mind I placed the order at 6:20 so we're approaching 1 hour to get a pizza and pasta. Guess I'll just keep sitting by the curb but probably won't ever do it again.

First frustrating experience here. Service is USUALLY OUTSTANDING. Today, though, to-go waitress was secretly on her phone while I waited. I didn't say anything just to see how long it I would take... about 3-4 minutes. Sounds petty, but I ordered take out for a reason. Salad wasn't ready 20 minutes after estimated pick up time. At least they gave me extra bread. Salads are best here still.
Customer service here is a joke. Why offer online ordering and curbside pickup if it still takes 30 minutes to pick up your food? This is insane. Am I in Redondo Beach?
Food is good but pricy. I usually don't mind pricy when service makes up for it. That isn't the case here. Go next door to Red Robin if you want good food, service, and timely responsiveness.
This place has gone down hill recently. The service  has been terrible the last few times we have come. Doesn't matter if it's lunch or dinner, service is terrible.

I came in, ordered two pizzas to go, thinking I'd like to have a quiet dinner at home.  They said it would be 20 minutes, even though it wasn't busy.  Lots of empty tables.  So I sat there with my wife and six week old baby.  And sat. And sat. And sat.  Anyway, 40 minutes later they hand me my food with not a word about why the eff it took so long.  I'm never going back to this place again.

Long story short I was over charged about $50 LAST WEEK and I'm still waiting on my "refund" to "process" because terminals are "malfunctioning". Now if I would've came there and been unable to pay it would've been a problem so I don't really care about a terminal being down that's a personal problem, not mine, my problem is 50 of my dollars are on a hold because of someone else mistake
I like CPK pizzas. This branch specifically is good. The staff are very caring and professional.

My daughter and I came to have lunch here and met the most delightful server name Daniela, her personality was amazing her love to please the customer was very infectious of laughter, she was very well adversed on the menu this was our first time here we definitely will come back, the manager Izzy was amazing very social and truly enjoyed his work. Please truly try this amazing place. thanks Maria Scott

This used to be my go to location. Not anymore!! I will drive further for good service and not return here. Curbside pickup should never be 30 minutes, especially parked in front of the valet at the mall.  They just don't have their shit together here. Last time we dined inside my pizza wasn't ready until my entire family was finished eating. The manager on duty walked past us 4 times and never said sorry or even tell me what the hell happened. The server was clueless too. He said oh I think they burned the first one. Really??  Nope never again.

I haven't been to CPK in years...and now I know why. Service is really slow, but the people are friendly and nice. I noticed the tables take a while for them to be cleared and cleaned. Walking from one side of the restaurant to the other to use the restroom I noticed a handful of dirty table. Granted they were not super busy, but still. Very unappetizing.  I personally find the food over-priced for basic dishes. The pizza is good and it's a pretty big portion. The jambalaya is also good with a good spice/kick to it. I personally have had better at different restaurants and for cheaper. I will say that the butter cake is delicious! I mean you cant really mess up butter cake. I didn't like the whipped cream that came with the dish it did not taste right at all!

I usually wait until I leave to write a review, but this place is pretty awful and am having a negative experience at this location.  Slow service. Like glacier pace. The food came out in no particular order, and ended up requesting to have the mac and cheese boxed to go because we had to leave after waiting 2 hours for dishes to still come out.  Appetizers were served before water was on our table, and service was just really awful.  Very disappointed and embarrassed to bring a large party here.
My family and I went to celebrate my graduation and enjoyed the meal so much! The cauliflower buffalo was amazing! The salads were green and so fresh! The sangria did not disappoint! We will be back!

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I took my two daughters here for dinner. I've always liked this location because it's a nice area snd it's attached to the mall. We had a very nice server by the name of Jessica. We were greeted and seated immediately. It took Jessica awhile to help us but she acknowledged that we had been seated in her station and she's be right with us.  Meanwhile someone else did come over and take our drink order as well as asked us if we were ready to place our order .  The night started off pleasant but very quickly went south.  It took forever to take our order, food took forever to come out and when it did it was cold.  Our server was a sweetheart and it wasn't her fault but everything about our visit was unpleasant.  Although I was extremely disappointed This one bad experience won't keep me from returning

Waitress didn't seem to be interested in anything at all, how would you expect to make tips if your customers are not in your concern. Took her 3 trips to bring a small back do to go and ends up being a huge grocery bag instead. The salad was whatever, I expected the BBQ chicken to be warm but it was taken out of the frig just as the whole salad was, the cucumber drink was way over sweetened with the Agave that it wasn't refreshing as suppose to and the kids pizza I suppose topped off the 2 stars. I am not a CPK person but people always rave about this place, so now I definitely know why I don't come here.

I love cpk. And eat it often. Recently moved to the South Bay. I regret coming to this location every time. Service is always terrible. Food is mediocre. I have complained to corporate in the past about the terrible servers (with hopes the re-train them) and even with free food coupons, I will never go here again. We had to wait 45 minutes for our food last time we decided to eat there. The "server" did not come to us and apologize for the long wait or to explain about the hold up and was just standing around. The manager was doing more serving duties then the server. We asked for the manager to complain about the food taking so long. And even after we complained to management (and she was very nice, btw) the server still didn't make us feel at ease about our experience (saying sorry etc). This was literally the 5th bad experience at this location. I will drive the extra miles to the Manhattan Beach location in an effort to never go here again. Do yourself a favor and don't eat at this location.

Went there for lunch today. The meal started off right with really good bread that came to the table warm and crusty. It was downhill after that. The pizza came out cold and had to be sent back. Seems like we waited a long time for it to come back. By the time it came back, we had already finished the regular size order of the buffalo chicken salad. The salad was pretty dismal. The lettuce was too cold, there was very little chicken or anything else on the salad and what was there was just bland. Considering the salad was $16, I would have expected that it be more substantial and flavorful. When the pizza did arrive, it had a nice crust but the toppings were skimpy. Each piece had about 1 small piece of chicken. The only thing that was plentiful was the onions of all things. I would have expected more toppings for $15.  I should have known that something was up when I arrived at prime lunch time on the weekend and there was no wait. Guess I'm not the only one that isn't impressed with CPK.

The service was okay but the real problem was that the food took a long time to be ready. We also had to wait a long time for drinks. It wasn't too busy but I over heard one of the waiters telling customers that they kept burning the food or not making enough for their plate. First of all you don't tell the customer that. Second what the hell. It was almost an hour to get some pasta and a sandwich.

I usually love going to CPK, but this location is not the best.  Came for lunch yesterday with a group of 4 kids and 2 adults.  The service was so slow, and there was barely anyone in the restaurant!  We ordered right away, and it took an incredible amount of time for the food to come out, which was not fun with 4 hungry kids.  I have been to many other CPK locations with my kids before and food never takes this long.  Also, our server didn't even offer us any bread, and when we asked, she took over 10 minutes to bring it out.  She was very nice, but everything was just too slow.  Willing to give them another chance to see if service is better next time.

Slow service and the food was inedible. This is my Cesar salad. Completely watered down and soggy. It seems as if they washed the lettuce and didn't dry it off. It was not the normal dressing for CPK.  My daughters noodles were over cooked. It amazes me when it's clear the food was not eaten and no one asks if anything was wrong with it. Still sitting here waiting on the bill and it has been over 10 minutes. Would not recommend this CPK.
This place is really slow in service. I've come to this place a couple times and it's always the same service. SLOW.

First and last time I ever dine at CPK!!! I heard how great the food was here. Not at all! I dont know if the food is the same at every location, or if it was just here in Hawthorne. First of all, the service was horrible. We had a young server with blonde hair who seemed to hate her job (or maybe just my family and I). She seemed annoyed when I asked her the ingredients in a pizza. I had to ask her twice because I couldn't understand what she was saying. Second, we waited about an hour before we got our dinner. We would have left, but my children, husband and I were very hungry and we didn't have extra time since we had movie tickets and the movie was close to starting. When we finally got our dinner it was COLD!!!! Yes! It must have been sitting there for a while before they brought it to us. My husband's pizza was hard, my kids had to rip the pieces off their pizza and my pasta was cold and tasteless. Horrible food! Horrible service!The waitress didn't even come to ask if we were doing ok. I strongly recommend that you dont waste your time at this horrible location. Will never come here again!
My God!  yesterday we went there to have dinner...service is terrible! it takes 45 min. when they served our food! Geez  this is 2nd time! we're not coming back to this place!
Spending good money with some rude customer service by the take out people here Megan was very quick to hang up multiple times when I was describing where I'm at to pick up my food.
Shit was whack; food, service, prices. Small portions and very expensive for mediocre food. Christopher  v. You know this shit sucks!
Erick was so patient and so helpful with my family and I! Food was great and service was excellent! Chicken tequila fettuccini was amazing! Highly recommend

CPK is a favorite of ours HOWEVER Southbay Galleria location needs to do better with customer service. For some reason there were alot of employees standing around chatting i.e. doing nothing =slow service & this last visit the food wasn't the best.  **Training 101 management

This location is horrible.  I don't know if it is management or they have a difficult time finding good employees.  I love the Manhattan Beach location. But I am done with this one.  I have given them several chances. They screw up take out orders every single time.  This time I redeemed a credit I had from a previous take out fiasco (horrible food quality, forgot items). I see all the boxes and glance and see what I thought was my salad, got home and realized it was not the one I ordered, someone else's name on it, and if it didn't have meat on it I would have just kept it.  So when I return the take out server would barely look at me and said very little handed it to me took the wrong salad and looked away. They screw up yet again and she has the nerve to be rude about it.

Called in for pickup at 9:10pm... asked to place a pickup order and was told to "hold on one sec" Then was put on hold and they did not get back until 9:15pm, when they told me they didn't take pickups after 9:15. Lol thanks so much for the great customer service. Keeping me on hold until pickup orders are not taken then denying my order, which I was able to place online in their "online order". I have eaten there before and people stay wayyyy past closing so not sure why I couldn't come pick up my order at 9:20, before they closed. Thank you so much for helping me decide where I will NOT be going for dinner anymore...

I ordered via the Grubhub app so I could pick up on my lunch break. Waited 45 minutes before I went down to pick up and they still hadn't put the order in even though I was 20 mins past the ready for pick up time they originally gave me. Won't be coming back here for lunch anytime soon.

I'm writing this review as I'm sitting here waiting for my desert that I had been waiting to order for 10 minutes because all the servers are standing in the back chatting and eating food. I can see them from where I'm sitting. I asked the server were they short staffed and she said yes. Not true! Oh did I mention that it's only 6 tables that are being occupied as well. I'll never come back here again. Horrible service.

I visited this location 4 days ago and was very disappointed with the service.  I believe that the server was named Jessica but I'm not 100% certain.  (She was a curvy Caucasian girl with a nose ring and brown hair.). I unexpectedly ran into a friend of mine and we walked here for lunch.  My friend is on a special diet and therefore had a lot of questions about the items on the menu.  And yes I do admit that she asked questions but when you have dietary restrictions you have to make sure you don't eat anything that will make you sick.  There isn't a lot of fresh food items here and also not many organic/vegetarian/vegan options on the menu so you essentially have to pick something and figure out what to tell the cook to take off.  You could tell that when my friend started asking questions our server got annoyed and didn't want to answer.  We ordered wine and the wine glass on the table so we asked for a replacement which she literally just came and left on the table without even saying here you go or making eye contact, she just had a total attitude.  I had to ask about four times for bread which finally came out at the same time as our food.  My companion ordered a bowl and when we received the order it was incorrect.  She asked for no meat and it had meat.  She asked for extra cilantro and it had no cilantro at all.  When she asked the waitress if the bowl had cilantro she just shook her head yes without even checking.  Eventually our server just stopped coming to our table.  I ended up asking other servers to refill our drinks and bring the cilantro that was missing.  Bottom line is that if you work in customer service you are expected to provide good service and not show if you're having a bad day, etc.  I'm not sure if my friend left a tip but I did not as I don't tip for poor service & someone who just stops coming to the table because they've decided they don't want to be bothered with you anymore.

Excellent customer service and servers! I love their free freshly baked bread with olive oil! My favorite is their strawberry lemonade. So delicious. I always get the Thai chicken salad! Tastes great! Even the half size is a good portion!

I always come to this CPK during the day and last night was my first time visiting at night and WOW can you tell the difference. My family and I were seated immediately and our waitress I believe her name started with an L took our order for drinks. When she brought them she didn't even bother to make any comments or ask if we were ready to order she just slid the drinks onto the table & walked away. She then returned took our order and we never saw her again till she picked up our check.  Our food was brought out by another waiter and our check brought out by the manager. Our table was all out of our drinks half way through our meal and not once did our waitress come by and ask if we wanted refills, mind you she walked by us multiple times and didn't even look at us.  I loved this CPK, but I can definitely say my family & I will not be returning. Horrible horrible service!

CPK, why do you continue to disappoint!? Came here for lunch because I love CPK's menu.. I think it is great for lunch and the prices for the portions work out. NOW, I come specifically for the mango iced tea, spinach dip, lunch salads and pizza.. service is not much of a wager because the menu is fresh, trendy and satisfying. I have had three terrible experiences; two in the last two months at this location in the Southbay galleria.. and another last week at their HB location in Bella Terra. A combination of me being lazy and me not wanting to be negative, I chose not to review my suck-ass terrible experiences. HOWEVER, today was ridiculous. It always fascinates me how managers and employees in a restaurant can be standing around and not showing a sense of urgency you when I am waiting 30+ minutes for an appetizer.. I just omg get that. And I truly feel that the management team and servers are clueless in recognizing that patrons are annoyed and not enjoying their dining experience. Today arrived at this restaurant right at opening at 11 AM and promptly ordered our appetizers. We ordered the buffalo cauliflower and spicy Asian pepper appetizer.. We received your appetizers at 11:31!!!!! The cauliflower was icebox cold. WTH!? Then, we sat there waiting for refills the entire 30 minutes we waited for our apps..no joke. Then 11:46 AM, still waiting for our actual lunch. This is the slowest service EVER experienced and no acknowledgement of it, no manager to even tell. Our server stopped by finally with refills and asked how everything was tasting but as I was beginning to respond she continued walking, LOL. Anyway. Check was dropped-off before I could order the pumpkin cheesecake. I really like this place but it has gone down hill in the last year.. i've been coming here and MB location for 15 years plus. It could do so much better if people actually put their heart into the service. I often have to convince my family to join me at CPK because they don't really see the value in waiting long to be served. Get it together CPK!

For a place named California PIZZA kitchen you'd probably expect a good tasting pizza. What I got was a thin tortilla stretched 7 inches. Not only was it mediocre, it was thin enough to be stacked on top of eachother to create one actual pizza slice. My high school made better pizza and less greasy. This crappy pizza actually made my stomach hurt. Spend your money on a real pizza parlor; do yourself a favor and skip California Tortilla with tomato sauce ontop Kitchen.

Reviewing to-go orders placed on online website. Placed orders a handful of times with no issues.  First off, website is great. Easy to use and there's a section for special instructions where I put "side of ranch" and not once have they forgotten to give it to me. 15 minute wait time for "ASAP" online orders which is great and is already done by the time I get there. I usually just go straight to the to-go area (forget the curbside, if you're in a rush. I haven't tried it and probably wouldn't ever.) I have to say I've encountered 2 different day managers there throughout my visits and they are always friendly and willing to help, which they do. Today there was a long line of to-go orders and I was in and out of there within 5-7 minutes with the help of the lady manager. I could tell she was busy but was still upbeat and nice.  In other visits, the waitress who checks me out asks if I want bread and oil which is great! Another visit, the guy manager, super friendly, asked if I wanted a complimentary drink, I didn't take it since I already had one in the car but just those little touches makes my visits here more enjoyable. I'll always come back, not only for their service but because of their delicious lunch duos. I always get the sausage, pepperoni and mushroom pizza with tortilla soup. Yum!  Restaurant is clean as well +++

Fresh food, refreshing drinks. Great end to my hard work day. Alexis, our server was very friendly, great smile. Very welcoming. Best I've seen in a while. I have visited Culver City and Marina Del Rey CPK and this has been the nicest CPK I've visited.

We ear out way too much - so we know what we are talking about.  Tonight's service was phenomenal - Chris took great care of us - extra bread when we asked, all requests were fast and courteous!   Food was great, as usual.
I love this place, the employees arr great, just hate that they changed the jambalaya  but other than that I have not one bad word to say. Love it!!!!!

I love CPK but this is one of the worst experiences I've had. I decided to go to this one since I was running errands around the area, the service was horrible. I waited 15 minutes for my server to notice me and finally ask me if I wanted a refreshment or was ready to order. When I asked for refills she never brought them and I didn't get to order any dessert since she was so eager to have me leave. The only thing good about my experience was the food. I don't recommend this place, go to manhattan village and ask for CK his service and attention to detail is amazing.

If it wasn't for my kid, I wouldn't go back.  Now my previous review of their pizza was a bit harsh.  It doesn't suck, it's just not amazing.  Now, as far as their service goes, those waitresses are idiots.  I'm about a month late writing this review, but my daughter has requested CPK for dinner so we are going back tonight.  Our last meal here was comical.  The waitress had us wait a solid 10 minutes before coming around.  We placed our drink order with our food order, including our daughters.  10-15 minutes later the male waitress brought out spaghetti for our daughter and took off.   Too bad we ordered chicken nuggets.  He came back quickly and seemed confused, and removed the pasta without us saying anything.  A few minutes later the rest of our food came out, sans our daughters food and the fucking truffle oil for my pizza!  How is it that every waitress at this location can't remember to bring out the damn truffle oil!!  We flagged down the bus boy and requested the truffle oil and our daughters food.  Two minutes later the waitress came over with the oil and he said that our daughters food would be out shortly, and that the manager is on top of it.  Half way through our meal the manager brings out the chicken nuggets and asks us who ordered the chicken nuggets.  Seriously.  I was irritated and probably shouldn't have been so rude, but I simply said, "The person NOT eating".  The manager dropped it off and asked if we needed anything.  I wanted to reply and say yes, a better management team that can train their staff.  But I bit my tongue.  I'm bringing my own bottle of truffle oil tonight, in case they forget the truffle oil that I would gladly pay for.  It's amazing that a restaurant of this size can have such awful waitresses.

This is a really nice venue - you can sit at the bar area and get a drink before being sitted at your table. I was hesitate about this location due to all the bad reviews about customer service. However, I was pleasantly surprised that only part of it was true - they didn't bring all of our food out at the same time and one didn't come until the very end. I mean how can they take that long to make tacos? Apparently, another large party came in during the same time as us. However, the waiters apologized and gave free soups to the people who were still waiting for their food. - FREE BREAD/OLIVE OIL & HERB DIP: I ate so much of this.. and they kept refilling it too. - SPINACH ARTICHOKE DIP: I'm not a huge spinach fan but this dip was really good! It was freshly made and the spinach and artichoke were not overpowering. - AVOCADO CLUB EGG ROLLS: interesting take on egg rolls; they're filled with American beloved ingredients such as bacon, cheese, and avocado.  - KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI: spaghetti with shrimps, hot red chilies, peanuts, and garlic! The chilies were no joke! But I think it balanced out well with the sweet spaghetti sauce. I wish I didn't eat so much bread and appetizers beforehand though.  I wish they had a wider selection of beer but they seem to specialize in cocktails.

This place used to be so good. Over the years corporate has changed portions and lack of flavor. But not neglecting the increase of pricing.  Spinach dip app had stale chips. For almost $12.  The child portion of pasta seemed to forge the meat in the meat sauce.  And the shrimp zucchini pasta (olive oil base) was flavorless. Had to ask for Alfredo to moisten it up.  Our server was super nice and very attentive!!  Kinda done with this franchise. It just wasn't the location, product in general.

What happened to CPK? When we arrived for a very early dinner, the restaurant was half full, but we were told the wait would be about 20 to 30 minutes.  We waited a while, and were seated about a half hour later. We already decided what to order since we had a lot of time to look at the menu, but we waited again for a server to show up. The hostess finally came by to take our drink orders.   After a while, a nice waiter came to take our food order.  My husband ordered a new item on the menu...short ribs over macaroni and cheese.  I had my usual penne with garlic cream sauce and shrimp.  Both dishes were surprisingly bland and flavorless.  I watched my husband force himself to eat his short rib dish.  It was painful to see. No one came by to check on us until we were almost done with our meal, or I might have said something.  We got our check and waited a long time again for someone to take our payment. I'm disappointed that I couldn't give more than a 2-star rating.  The entire South Bay Galleria is dying and unfortunately, CPK may be facing some problems of their own.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Went in with my lady in early in the morning, the restaurant was close to empty knowing it was a Saturday morning We were immediately seated and attended by a waiter who took our drinks very nice We ordered the second time waiter came around and after that we waited about an hour for a small pizza and pasta I also noticed a family come in after me and was given their food faster than ours. One thing I noticed is the amount of waiters walking around doing nothing but disrupting peoples conversation asking if everything is alright when they were just asked. Did not pay for the food or anything. They took too long. Went. To Carl's Jr next st over.
